MALAYSIA SHORTS

News aggregated and shorten to save your precious time!

  • RUSSIA TO PRESS ITS SU-57 FIGHTERS FOR BIG ONSLAUGHT ON UKRAINE; COULD BE USED FOR TYPICAL STEALTH MISSIONS

    https://eurasiantimes.com/russia-to-press-its-su-57-fighters-for-big-onslaught-on-ukraine-could-be-used-for-typical-stealth-missions/

    02/19/2023, 12:08

    70.0% Shortened!

    Being its most advanced fighter, Russia is unlikely to fly it within Ukrainian airspace, where it might become a target for Western surface-to-air missile (SAM) systems

    These are the National Advanced Surface-to-Air Missile System (NASAMS), the German IRIS-T, and powerful Soviet-origin S-300 and Buk defense systems

    This is particularly true given the fact that the war has been less characterized by airpower, featuring heavy air-to-air combat, regular bombing, and air dominance operations

    Russia’s Su-35S, Su-30SM2, and MiG-35 are not only sufficient for the little air superiority and combat air patrol (CAP) missions but also to take on Western jets like the Eurofighter Typhoon, F-16, F-15, and possibly the F-35

    It has two large internal weapon bays mounted in tandem between the engines and two side bays for short-range air-to-air missiles

    The ten internal and six external hardpoints can carry R-74M Archer and R-77M Adder air-to-air missile (AAM); Kh-38M air-to-surface missiles; Kh-31AD and Kh-35U anti-ship missiles and; Kh-31PD and Kh-58UShK anti-radiation missiles

    ['russia', 'fighter', 'air', 'use', 'defense']

    Being its most advanced fighter, Russia is unlikely to fly it within Ukrainian airspace, where it might become a target for Western surface-to-air missile (SAM) systems

    These are the National Advanced Surface-to-Air Missile System (NASAMS), the German IRIS-T, and powerful Soviet-origin S-300 and Buk defense systems

    This is particularly true given the fact that the war has been less characterized by airpower, featuring heavy air-to-air combat, regular bombing, and air dominance operations

    Russia’s Su-35S, Su-30SM2, and MiG-35 are not only sufficient for the little air superiority and combat air patrol (CAP) missions but also to take on Western jets like the Eurofighter Typhoon, F-16, F-15, and possibly the F-35

  • EARTHQUAKE: MALAYSIA SENDS FIRST HUMANITARIAN AID MISSION TO SYRIA

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/02/19/earthquake-malaysia-sends-first-humanitarian-aid-mission-to-syria

    02/19/2023, 10:09

    68.42% Shortened!

    Sunday, 19 Feb 2023

    SUBANG, 18 Feb -- Chief of Royal Malaysian Air Force (RMAF) Datuk Seri Mohd Asghar Khan Goriman Khan poses for a photo while attending the earthquake humanitarian aid delivery mission to Syria at the RMAF Subang Air Base on Saturday.

    The statement also thanked all Malaysians who responded to the call to lend aid to the earthquake victims in Syria

    "Among the NGOs that have also made this mission a success are the Malaysian Red Crescent Society, Mercy Malaysia, BeVital Ihsan Johor, RED A Humanitarian, Malaysia For Syria, Wisma Putra Global Peace Mission, MAHAR, MCRD, Shine Catholic Church, Yemeni School Foundation and Syrian People Malaysia," read statement

    Meanwhile, a journalist from the Malaysian National News Agency (Bernama), Siti Zanariah Nor Zin, also joined the aid mission team to provide coverage from Syria

    A 7.8-magnitude earthquake that hit southern Turkey and northwestern Syria on Feb 6 has claimed thousands of lives.- Bernama

    ['feb', 'malaysian', 'earthquake', 'humanitarian', 'aid']

    Sunday, 19 Feb 2023

    SUBANG, 18 Feb -- Chief of Royal Malaysian Air Force (RMAF) Datuk Seri Mohd Asghar Khan Goriman Khan poses for a photo while attending the earthquake humanitarian aid delivery mission to Syria at the RMAF Subang Air Base on Saturday.

    The statement also thanked all Malaysians who responded to the call to lend aid to the earthquake victims in Syria

    "Among the NGOs that have also made this mission a success are the Malaysian Red Crescent Society, Mercy Malaysia, BeVital Ihsan Johor, RED A Humanitarian, Malaysia For Syria, Wisma Putra Global Peace Mission, MAHAR, MCRD, Shine Catholic Church, Yemeni School Foundation and Syrian People Malaysia," read statement

  • KIT SIANG: SETTLEMENT OF APANDI’S SUIT AGAINST DR MAHATHIR MUST BE MADE PUBLIC

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2023/02/19/kit-siang-settlement-of-apandis-suit-against-dr-mahathir-must-be-made-public/55651

    02/19/2023, 10:09

    45.45% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Feb 19 — DAP veteran Lim Kit Siang today said that keeping the settlement terms of former Attorney General Tan Sri Mohamad Apandi Ali’s lawsuit against Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad private goes against the public interest

    He said public interest required all terms be made public and it was indefensible to keep it a secret as Apandi had already stated the amount he was seeking for his dismissal which was RM2.23 million

    He called on the government to review and reverse its decision

    “Public interest requires the out-of-court settlement to be made public

    The Cabinet should reverse the decision to keep the out of court settlement from the knowledge of the public, as the government is acting on behalf of the public,” Lim said in a statement this morning

    Azalina said that Apandi’s lawyers and the Attorney-General’s Chambers had agreed during the negotiations for settlement that the settlement terms would be kept confidential and not disclosed to the public

    ['say', 'keep', 'settlement', 'term', 'apandi']

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Feb 19 — DAP veteran Lim Kit Siang today said that keeping the settlement terms of former Attorney General Tan Sri Mohamad Apandi Ali’s lawsuit against Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad private goes against the public interest

    He said public interest required all terms be made public and it was indefensible to keep it a secret as Apandi had already stated the amount he was seeking for his dismissal which was RM2.23 million

    He called on the government to review and reverse its decision

    “Public interest requires the out-of-court settlement to be made public

    The Cabinet should reverse the decision to keep the out of court settlement from the knowledge of the public, as the government is acting on behalf of the public,” Lim said in a statement this morning

    Azalina said that Apandi’s lawyers and the Attorney-General’s Chambers had agreed during the negotiations for settlement that the settlement terms would be kept confidential and not disclosed to the public

    ['say', 'keep', 'settlement', 'term', 'apandi']

    76.92% Shortened!

    1 women’s doubles pair Pearly Tan-M

    Thinaah kept Malaysia’s hopes alive by outplaying Liu Shengshu-Tan Ning 21-17, 12-21, 21-19

    However, independent mixed doubles pair Tan Kian Meng-Lai Pei Jing lost to Feng Yanzhe-Huang Dongping 15-21, 23-25 in the decisive fifth match

    Badminton Association of Malaysia (BAM) high performance director Tim Jones was unhappy with the exit because Malaysia were stronger on paper and he was expecting a rematch with India in the last four

    Malaysia lost 1-4 to India in their last Group B match on Thursday

    Thinaah 17-21, 21-12, 19-21; Feng Yanzhe-Huang Dongping bt Tan Kian Meng-Lai Pei Jing 21-15, 25-23).

  • CYCLONE DEATH TOLL IN NEW ZEALAND RISES TO 11 AS RECOVERY CONTINUES

    https://www.channelnewsasia.com/world/new-zealand-death-toll-cyclone-gabrielle-recovery-continues-north-island-3289231

    02/19/2023, 10:08

    66.67% Shortened!

    The cyclone hit the North Island's uppermost region on Feb 12 and tracked down the east coast, inflicting widespread devastation

    Prime Minister Chris Hipkins has called Gabrielle New Zealand's biggest natural disaster this century

    On Sunday, police said two more people had died in the hard-hit Hawke's Bay area in circumstances related to the cyclone, raising the death toll to 11

    Of those, almost 40,000 were in Hawke's Bay, out of a population of about 170,000

    Prime Minister Hipkins has said the crisis response is "still underway" and that people across the North Island are "working around the clock"

    Police have sent an extra 100 officers to Hawke's Bay and nearby Tairawhiti, including to isolated areas, and the New Zealand Herald reported roadblocks around a rural Hawke’s Bay village to deter looters

    ['cyclone', 'bay', 'new', 'zealand', 'people']

    The cyclone hit the North Island's uppermost region on Feb 12 and tracked down the east coast, inflicting widespread devastation

    Prime Minister Chris Hipkins has called Gabrielle New Zealand's biggest natural disaster this century

    On Sunday, police said two more people had died in the hard-hit Hawke's Bay area in circumstances related to the cyclone, raising the death toll to 11

    Of those, almost 40,000 were in Hawke's Bay, out of a population of about 170,000

    Prime Minister Hipkins has said the crisis response is "still underway" and that people across the North Island are "working around the clock"

    Police have sent an extra 100 officers to Hawke's Bay and nearby Tairawhiti, including to isolated areas, and the New Zealand Herald reported roadblocks around a rural Hawke’s Bay village to deter looters

    ['cyclone', 'bay', 'new', 'zealand', 'people']

    86.96% Shortened!

    That means Vietnamese company Cricket One, for example, may market its partially defatted house cricket (Acheta domesticus) powder

    Mixing insect powder into biscuits or flour is “really still a long way off,” says Valet

    But many foods, including insect powder, can trigger rare allergic reactions

    Why would you use insect powder anyway? Not for commercial reasons, if you ask Valet

    How nutritious are insects? People around the world eat more than 1,900 species of insect

    Insect farming also releases fewer greenhouse gases

    Meanwhile, the Health Ministry's GitHub data repository reported that one Covid-19 death was reported on Saturday

    This brings the death toll to 36,955.

  • JOËL MATIP SUCCESSION PLAN MAY HAVE BECOME CLEAR AS LIVERPOOL 'OPEN TRANSFER TALKS' FOR DEFENDER

    https://www.liverpool.com/liverpool-fc-news/features/liverpool-transfer-talks-joel-matip-26272423

    02/19/2023, 09:09

    66.67% Shortened!

    Liverpool could be in the market for a defensive player in the summer as Jürgen Klopp's staff look to steal a march on Premier League rivals for a 19-year-old talent

    With this in mind, one would posit that Klopp's staff are already working in the background to ensure that Liverpool's squad remains future-proofed

    With Trent Alexander Arnold and youngster Calvin Ramsay possibly representing Liverpool's long-term options in the right full-back areas, it would perhaps make more sense for Mantilla to, therefore, be a long-term option for the Reds in the centre of defense

    With question marks currently surrounding Joel Matip's long-term future at Liverpool — he has less than 18 months left on his current contract — one would posit that it makes perfect sense that Jürgen Klopp's staff would be scouring the market for a successor

    Sign up to the Liverpool.com newsletter here — it only takes a few seconds! On top of this, Mantilla is intriguingly left-footed, with Transfermarkt claiming that he is also comfortable in the left-sided centre-back role

    In short, the 19-year-old's ability to potentially play a number of positions across the backline would surely make him an asset for the majority of clubs, including Liverpool

    ['liverpool', 'rgen', 'klopp', 'would', 'red']

  • MUHYIDDIN WON'T TOLERATE INSINUATIONS

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/02/19/muhyiddin-wont-tolerate-insinuations

    02/19/2023, 09:08

    76.92% Shortened!

    He maintained that he did not take any money from the Covid-19 vaccine procurement

    On Feb 16, Muhyiddin was called in by MACC for questioning following accusations made against him about Jana Wibawa, a programme by the Finance Ministry to help bumiputra contractors affected by the Covid-19 pandemic

    It had nothing to do with Jana Wibawa, he added

    He also said that he did not know the names of the companies involved in the Jana Wibawa programme

    Muhyiddin also said that the MACC investigating officer did not ask any questions on the alleged billions said to have been accumulated during his tenure as prime minister

    “I explained to MACC that I have all the papers to prove what went on.” He also said that the Jana Wibawa programme was the brainchild of former finance minister Tengku Datuk Seri Zafrul Tengku Abdul Aziz

  • YOURSAY | LYNAS DOESN'T EVEN MEET M'SIAN EIA REPORTING STANDARD

    https://www.malaysiakini.com/news/655595

    02/19/2023, 09:08

    85.0% Shortened!

    The author of the RIA report is an employee of Lynas and he is a member of the EIA study team

    Another member of the team is also a service provider for Lynas

    Lynas boasts it operates based on the highest international standards

    When Lynas walks away, the money Malaysia has to spend to store the waste would be more than what we could possibly gain from Lynas continuing its operation here

    Lynas has been taking advantage of local politics to maintain its presence here

    The business case for running the plant under the new conditions is Lynas’, not the government’s

  • TREASURY BILLS OFFER STOCK-LIKE 5% TO TAKE FED, DEBT-LIMIT RISK

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/treasury-bills-offer-stock-5-210000350.html

    79.31% Shortened!

    One-year bill yields approached the threshold

    On the auction front next week, the Treasury plans to sell $60 billion of three-month bills, $48 billion of six-month bills and $34 billion of one-year paper, in addition to its slate of two-, five- and seven year-notes

    Three more quarter-point rate increases from the 4.5%-4.75% target range set on Feb

    More clarity about the scope for rates to rise may come next week from the release of the minutes of the central bank’s Feb

    “You can’t bet that the Fed is going to get to a terminal rate and then start going back down and be back at 4.5% by the end of the year

    That’s just not what the market should be thinking.” What to Watch Economic data calendar Feb

    ['bill', 'week', 'rate', 'year', 'fed']

    On the auction front next week, the Treasury plans to sell $60 billion of three-month bills, $48 billion of six-month bills and $34 billion of one-year paper, in addition to its slate of two-, five- and seven year-notes

    Three more quarter-point rate increases from the 4.5%-4.75% target range set on Feb

    More clarity about the scope for rates to rise may come next week from the release of the minutes of the central bank’s Feb

    “You can’t bet that the Fed is going to get to a terminal rate and then start going back down and be back at 4.5% by the end of the year

    That’s just not what the market should be thinking.” What to Watch Economic data calendar Feb

    ['bill', 'week', 'rate', 'year', 'fed']

  • CHELSEA 'PUT FIVE PLAYERS UP FOR SALE THIS SUMMER'

    https://www.sportsmole.co.uk/football/chelsea/transfer-talk/news/chelsea-put-five-players-up-for-sale-this-summer_507039.html

    02/19/2023, 08:09

    50.0% Shortened!

    The Blues' misery under Graham Potter continued on Saturday afternoon, as the Premier League's basement side Southampton won 1-0 at Stamford Bridge thanks to James Ward-Prowse's free kick

    The Blues are also facing a last-16 exit from the Champions League following a 1-0 loss to Borussia Dortmund in Wednesday's first leg, with the German side set to visit Stamford Bridge for the second leg on March 7

    Out-of-favour striker Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang is also expected to be heading for the exit door at the end of the season, having recently been frozen out of the group under Potter

    The former Arsenal man was left out of the Blues' Champions League squad for the knockout stages and has also been cut from the ranks for each of their last three Premier League matches

    © Reuters As is the case with Mount, Aubameyang's contract at Stamford Bridge only runs until 2024, and he has just three goals to show from 17 appearances at the club since arriving from Barcelona

    In addition, Hakim Ziyech, Ruben Loftus-Cheek and Conor Gallagher are also viewed as expendable assets by Chelsea, who were on the verge of offloading the former to Paris Saint-Germain on loan in January

    Meanwhile, Loftus-Cheek now has fewer than 18 months left on his Blues contract, and he has only played 79 minutes of Premier League football for Potter's side since the World Cup

    ['blue', 'potter', 'premier', 'league', 'side']

    The Blues' misery under Graham Potter continued on Saturday afternoon, as the Premier League's basement side Southampton won 1-0 at Stamford Bridge thanks to James Ward-Prowse's free kick

    The Blues are also facing a last-16 exit from the Champions League following a 1-0 loss to Borussia Dortmund in Wednesday's first leg, with the German side set to visit Stamford Bridge for the second leg on March 7

    Out-of-favour striker Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang is also expected to be heading for the exit door at the end of the season, having recently been frozen out of the group under Potter

    The former Arsenal man was left out of the Blues' Champions League squad for the knockout stages and has also been cut from the ranks for each of their last three Premier League matches

    © Reuters As is the case with Mount, Aubameyang's contract at Stamford Bridge only runs until 2024, and he has just three goals to show from 17 appearances at the club since arriving from Barcelona

    In addition, Hakim Ziyech, Ruben Loftus-Cheek and Conor Gallagher are also viewed as expendable assets by Chelsea, who were on the verge of offloading the former to Paris Saint-Germain on loan in January

    81.25% Shortened!

    They say goodies such as the My50 travel pass and the RM100 ewallet credit allocated to Malaysians in the M40 category should also be retained to alleviate the pinch from the rising costs of living

    Engineer Chan Chee Kong, 27, said initiatives to ensure more affordable housing should be included in the retabled budget

    He also called for the government to look into increasing the baseline fares of taxis to ensure drivers could earn a better income

    He added that the RM100 ewallet credit for M40 groups with an annual income below RM100,000 should also be retained

    “Any increment to the initially announced amount will also be of great help,” he said

    It is set to be retabled on Friday

  • NORTH KOREA ICBM LAUNCH PART OF A 'SURPRISE DRILL': KCNA

    https://www.channelnewsasia.com/asia/north-korea-icbm-launch-surprise-drill-3289171

    02/19/2023, 08:08

    57.14% Shortened!

    This picture taken on Nov 18, 2022 and released by North Korea's official Korean Central News Agency (KCNA) shows the launch of North Korea's new intercontinental ballistic missile (ICBM) "Hwasong Gun 17", at Pyongyang International Airport

    Launched from the Pyongyang International Airport, the "missile traveled up to a maximum altitude of 5,768.5km and flew 989km for 4,015 seconds before accurately hitting the pre-set area in open waters of the East Sea of Korea", KCNA said, using the North's preferred term for the Sea of Japan

    KCNA reported that "the drill was suddenly organised without previous notice", and that North Korean leader Kim Jong Un had personally signed off on the test

    North Korea on Friday had threatened an "unprecedentedly" strong response to upcoming US-South Korea drills - which it described as preparations for war

    The surprise launch on Saturday, KCNA said, was "clear proof" of the reliability of North Korea's "powerful physical nuclear deterrent".

    Be among the first to know the Breaking news

    ['north', 'korea', 'kcna', 'launch', 'missile']

    This picture taken on Nov 18, 2022 and released by North Korea's official Korean Central News Agency (KCNA) shows the launch of North Korea's new intercontinental ballistic missile (ICBM) "Hwasong Gun 17", at Pyongyang International Airport

    Launched from the Pyongyang International Airport, the "missile traveled up to a maximum altitude of 5,768.5km and flew 989km for 4,015 seconds before accurately hitting the pre-set area in open waters of the East Sea of Korea", KCNA said, using the North's preferred term for the Sea of Japan

    KCNA reported that "the drill was suddenly organised without previous notice", and that North Korean leader Kim Jong Un had personally signed off on the test

    North Korea on Friday had threatened an "unprecedentedly" strong response to upcoming US-South Korea drills - which it described as preparations for war

  • 'GOVT SHOULD CONSIDER MORE AVENUES FOR TAX GENERATION'

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/02/19/govt-should-consider-more-avenues-for-tax-generation

    02/19/2023, 08:08

    80.65% Shortened!

    They say automation and digitisation measures for small and medium enterprises (SMEs) also warrant inclusion in the budget, which will be tabled on Feb 24

    Koong added that the government should also find ways to increase their revenue while keeping a lower tax rate in order to attract investors and retain talent

    He said foreign companies incorporated in Malaysia would have to pay the corporate income tax, which becomes another source of income for the government

    “This can attract higher-value foreign direct investments to Malaysia, which not only leads to another tax income for the government but also creates job opportunities and generates a higher income for Malaysians

    “This will encourage SMEs to make more profits, which also raises tax collections,” he said

    He also urged the government to retain the reduction of SMEs’ income tax from 17% to 15% for their first RM100,000 earned, as planned in Budget 2023, which was tabled in October last year

    ['government', 'tax', 'say', 'measure', 'also']

  • EARTHQUAKE: M'SIA'S FIRST HUMANITARIAN AID MISSION TO SYRIA

    https://www.thesundaily.my/local/earthquake-m-sia-s-first-humanitarian-aid-mission-to-syria-EC10654404

    02/19/2023, 07:17

    45.45% Shortened!

    The Ministry of Foreign Affairs in a statement said 42 tonnes of humanitarian aid items collected from Malaysians since Feb 15 were brought on board the plane

    The statement also thanked all Malaysians who responded to the call to lend aid to the earthquake victims in Syria

    “Among the NGOs that have also made this mission a success are the Malaysian Red Crescent Society, MERCY Malaysia, BeVital Ihsan Johor, RED A Humanitarian, Malaysia For Syria, WISMA PUTRA Global Peace Mission, MAHAR, MCRD, Shine Catholic Church, Yemeni School Foundation and Syrian People Malaysia,“ read statement

    Meanwhile, a journalist from the Malaysian National News Agency (Bernama), Siti Zanariah Nor Zin, also joined the aid mission team to provide coverage from Syria

    “I hope that the items being brought from here to Syria can be distributed well to the affected victims and hopefully this aid can ease the burden they are facing,“ she said before leaving tonight

    A 7.8-magnitude earthquake that hit southern Turkey and northwestern Syria on Feb 6 has claimed thousands of lives

    ['malaysia', 'aid', 'mission', 'syria', 'malaysian']

    https://www.liverpool.com/liverpool-fc-news/features/liverpool-champions-league-klopp-newcastle-26275104

    02/19/2023, 07:09

    71.43% Shortened!

    Liverpool beat Newcastle on their own turf on Saturday, with Jürgen Klopp inadvertently sending a message to Eddie Howe as both sides do battle for fourth spot

    It was not to send a message to Newcastle by any means, but one Klopp moment on the touchline summed up why Liverpool should give itself every hope of beating Eddie Howe's side in the final league standings, at least

    Klopp simply had options that Howe didn't

    Newcastle has, undoubtedly, done well to make itself a part of the conversation for the top four with the squad that Howe has at his disposal

    Should Liverpool find sufficient form in the final few months of this particular season, though, it should have more than enough to overhaul Newcastle and make the most of the advantage in depth that it currently has

    It is up to the Liverpool players, though, to prove that they are deserving of more top-level European football by finding some consistency at last.

    ['liverpool', 'newcastle', 'klopp', 'champion', 'league']

    Welcome to the ESPN Singapore Edition Mark Ogden believes Liverpool will secure a Champions League finish after their 2-0 win over Newcastle

    Nunez, 23, scored his first Premier League goal since before the World Cup to set Liverpool on course for a 2-0 win over Newcastle at St James' Park on Saturday -- a win which moves Jurgen Klopp's team up to eighth, six points behind fourth-placed Newcastle with a game in hand

    "Nunez has hurt his shoulder and he needs further assessment," Klopp said

    "We don't know any more at the moment, we will have to see, but it is painful for him." Despite closing the gap on Newcastle to revive Liverpool's hopes of a top four finish, Klopp said it is too early to gauge whether his team have finally turned a corner this season

    "When you are not in your best moment you have to fight for this, and that's what we did, we got our second win in a row

    "It's too early to say we are there again

    Beam Global (BEEM) The first stock we’ll look at is Beam Global, a company that works in clean energy products for EV charging

    This past November, the company reported a quarterly record of $6.6 million in total revenue for Q3 of fiscal year 2022, for a 227% year-over-year increase

    A common factor in these new orders is the ability of the company to deploy the product quickly and put it into action with a minimum of fuss

    The stock has a Strong Buy consensus rating, based on a unanimous 4 recent Buys

    In that report, for 3Q22, the company posted a top line of 44.1 million Euro (US$47.3 million), for a 140% increase year-over-year

    These comments provide solid support for Gianarikas' Buy rating on WBX stock, and his $13 price target implies a one-year upside potential of 122%

  • THE HOUSING MARKET HAS COOLED SO MUCH THAT EVEN DEEP-POCKETED INVESTORS ARE BACKING OFF

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/housing-market-cooled-much-even-210742008.html

    77.78% Shortened!

    Last year the average 30-year fixed mortgage rate rose to over 7%

    The year before, mortgage rates were at historic lows and demand was high, which fueled an investor frenzy within the housing market

    In the fourth quarter of 2022, investor home purchases plunged 45.8% compared to the same period the previous year, as mortgage rates rose and home prices declined, Redfin researchers wrote

    In Las Vegas, investor home purchases fell 67% in the fourth quarter of last year versus a year earlier, which Redfin’s researchers found to be the largest decline among the 40 metro areas they looked at

    Meanwhile, Baltimore was the only metro city Redfin analyzed with an increase in investor home purchases, rising 1.4%

    Redfin’s researchers found that investor purchases of single family homes dropped 49.8% year-over-year in the fourth quarter of 2022

    ['home', 'year', 'investor', 'purchase', 'housing']

    Last year the average 30-year fixed mortgage rate rose to over 7%

    The year before, mortgage rates were at historic lows and demand was high, which fueled an investor frenzy within the housing market

    In the fourth quarter of 2022, investor home purchases plunged 45.8% compared to the same period the previous year, as mortgage rates rose and home prices declined, Redfin researchers wrote

    In Las Vegas, investor home purchases fell 67% in the fourth quarter of last year versus a year earlier, which Redfin’s researchers found to be the largest decline among the 40 metro areas they looked at

    Meanwhile, Baltimore was the only metro city Redfin analyzed with an increase in investor home purchases, rising 1.4%

    Redfin’s researchers found that investor purchases of single family homes dropped 49.8% year-over-year in the fourth quarter of 2022

    ['home', 'year', 'investor', 'purchase', 'housing']

  • CHINA BLASTS US OVER 'HYSTERICAL' BALLOON CLAIM

    https://www.thesundaily.my/world/china-blasts-us-over-hysterical-balloon-claim-CC10654350

    02/18/2023, 22:08

    73.91% Shortened!

    Addressing a gathering of world leaders at the Munich Security Conference, Wang said President Joe Biden’s administration has a “misguided” perception of Beijing

    The spat had led US Secretary of State Antony Blinken to abruptly cancel a rare visit to China

    Washington, he said, had the wrong view of China as a serious geopolitical challenge and a threat to the United States

    “This is a misguided perception of China and with this perception, the United States is using all of its means to smear and clamp down China, and is co-opting other countries to do the same,“ he said

    - ‘Don’t make same mistake’ - After four years of antagonistic relations with China under his predecessor Donald Trump, US President Joe Biden has made a priority of resetting relations with Beijing -- which he describes as Washington’s biggest competitor

    “We should not make the same mistake with China and other authoritarian regimes,“ he cautioned

    ['china', 'wang', 'washington', 'balloon', 'say']

    Addressing a gathering of world leaders at the Munich Security Conference, Wang said President Joe Biden’s administration has a “misguided” perception of Beijing

    “This is a misguided perception of China and with this perception, the United States is using all of its means to smear and clamp down China, and is co-opting other countries to do the same,“ he said

    Saturday, 18 Feb 2023

    A suspected drug offender arrested by CNB officers in a two-week island-wide drug operation from 6 to 17 Feb 2023

    She was one of 133 suspected drug offenders who were arrested after a two-week drug operation from Feb 6 to 17 that covered areas including Hougang, Jurong and Tampines

    The woman’s two-month-old infant was also in the unit during her arrest, said CNB

    According to CNB’s annual statistics for 2022, there has been an increase in the number of cannabis seizures and new abusers of the drug

    About half of all new drug abusers arrested in 2022 were below the age of 30

    ['feb', 'suspect', 'drug', 'arrest', 'cnb']

    Saturday, 18 Feb 2023

    A suspected drug offender arrested by CNB officers in a two-week island-wide drug operation from 6 to 17 Feb 2023

  • GOVT HAS NO PLANS TO MANDATE PAID PRIVATE SECTOR INTERNSHIPS, SAYS MINISTRY

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/02/18/govt-has-no-plans-to-mandate-paid-internships-says-ministry

    02/18/2023, 22:08

    68.42% Shortened!

    Saturday, 18 Feb 2023

    In a statement posted on Facebook on Saturday (Feb 18), it said minister Hannah Yeoh, during her press conference on Feb 16, was only urging the private sector to emulate the government's paid internship policies

    On Feb 16, Yeoh responded to a question from Muar MP Syed Saddiq Syed Abdul Rahman during a press conference in Parliament, urging the government to implement paid internship programmes in the private sector

    Syed Saddiq, who was present during the press conference, echoed Yeoh's proposal

    During Syed Saddiq's tenure as youth and sports minister in 2019, the government had raised the allowances of paid internship in each federal ministry, government agencies and departments from RM300 to RM900

    Instead of compelling employers to pay internship allowance, he said the government should consider giving more incentives to employers to take in more interns and make it mandatory for all undergraduates to undergo internship

    ['government', 'allowance', 'private', 'internship', 'say']

    Syed Saddiq, who was present during the press conference, echoed Yeoh's proposal

    During Syed Saddiq's tenure as youth and sports minister in 2019, the government had raised the allowances of paid internship in each federal ministry, government agencies and departments from RM300 to RM900

  • DR ANNUAR: M'SIA'S EDUCATION SYSTEM NOT ON PAR WITH S'PORE, JAPAN DUE TO CONSTANT CHANGES IN POLICIES

    https://www.theborneopost.com/2023/02/18/dr-annuar-msias-education-system-not-on-par-with-spore-japan-due-to-constant-changes-in-policies/

    02/18/2023, 20:08

    45.45% Shortened!

    “When talking about education, I am more emotional and sensitive

    I do not agree with the Minister of Education Fadhlina Sidek’s statement in saying that our education curriculum is on par with Singapore and Japan,” he said

    Fadhlina, who is Member of Parliament for Nibong Tebal, has recently insisted that the school curriculum in Malaysia is comparable to the curriculum in other countries and that the Ministry of Education (MoE) has carried out a study of the school curriculum in this country with other countries such as Singapore, Australia, Japan, the United Kingdom and Finland

    Although our education system is the responsibility of the federal government under the Malaysian Constitution, he said the Sarawak government cares by creating a special ministry to improve education in the state

    The university subsidised fee, he added, would be almost the same as the fees of public universities such as Universiti Malaysia Sarawak, Universiti Putra Malaysia and other public universities in the state

    Also in attendance were PAVB chairman Pandi Suhaili; Bintulu District Education Officer Samri Suhaili and Harakah Islamiah Bintulu Branch (HIKMAH) chairman Yusuff Ali.

    ['bintulu', 'malaysia', 'education', 'say', 'curriculum']

    Instead of dwelling on their 2-3 loss to defending champions China, he suggested that they should shift their attention to the Sudirman Cup in Suzhou, China this May

    “The Badmintion Association of Malaysia (BAM) needs to have a discussion about team events and prepare well to ensure the team reaches the final,” he said when met recently

    The team needed to find their winning rhythm so that their confidence would turn into fighting spirit that they can use at the upcoming championship

    “I made my comeback during the Sudirman Cup in China previously, where I forced myself to not lose a single match

    Malaysia’s loss at the BAMTC is unsurprising as it is the third quarterfinal loss in the country’s history of participating in the championship, having lost previously in 2017 in Hanoi, Vietnam and in 2019 in Hong Kong

    The 2021 edition in Wuhan, China was cancelled due to the COVID-19 pandemic

  • HANNAH: PARA ATHLETES TO GET ESCORT IN INTERNATIONAL EVENT WITH IMMEDIATE EFFECT

    https://www.thesundaily.my/sport/hannah-para-athletes-to-get-escort-in-international-event-with-immediate-effect-KC10653988

    02/18/2023, 16:09

    45.45% Shortened!

    Its minister, Hannah Yeoh (pic) said the move was taken to ensure the safety and needs of para athletes during their participation apart from ensuring the focus of the athlete is not affected

    “I have ordered the National Sports Council (MSN) to coordinate the requirement so that para athletes could devote full attention to perform their best at international-level championship,” she told reporters after a working visit to the Malaysia Paralympic Sports Excellence Centre here today

    Hannah said the decision on the number of supporting officers for national para athletes is however subject to the participation quota stipulated by the organiser

    According to her, MSN and Paralympic Council of Malaysia (PCM) will ensure knowledgeable officers in the specific sport be given the responsibility of escorting officers

    “The decision is in line with Clause 12.4 on the Governance, Role and Responsibilities of Athlete Support Officers in the International Paralympic Committee (IPC) Athlete Classification Code

    Malaysia once again failed to end its losing streak in the quarter-finals of the tournament when the national team lost 2-3 to the ‘backup’ squad of China yesterday

  • KLANG COPS TRACKING DOWN FIVE ARMED ROBBERY SUSPECTS

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/02/18/klang-cops-tracking-down-five-armed-robbery-suspects

    02/18/2023, 16:09

    64.71% Shortened!

    Saturday, 18 Feb 2023

    SHAH ALAM Police here are tracking down five suspects believed to be involved in robbing a family of five using machetes in Taman Petaling, Klang on Friday (Feb 17) afternoon

    Klang Selatan district police chief ACP Cha Hoong Fong said all the suspects who wore masks and gloves and are believed to have entered the two-storey terraced house through the rear door where they parked their vehicle

    "Several suspects also hit a 45-year-old female victim on her nose and body before knocking her on the head with the back of a machete,” he said in a statement today

    According to Cha, the police received information about the getaway vehicle found in a residential alley in Taman Desawan, Klang, however, when the police arrived at the location, all the suspects had fled

    "The police are still tracking down the suspects involved, so those who have information about this incident are urged to contact Klang Selatan district police headquarters at 03-33762222 or any nearby police station," he added

    ['police', 'five', 'suspect', 'family', 'machete']

    Saturday, 18 Feb 2023

    SHAH ALAM Police here are tracking down five suspects believed to be involved in robbing a family of five using machetes in Taman Petaling, Klang on Friday (Feb 17) afternoon

    Klang Selatan district police chief ACP Cha Hoong Fong said all the suspects who wore masks and gloves and are believed to have entered the two-storey terraced house through the rear door where they parked their vehicle

    "Several suspects also hit a 45-year-old female victim on her nose and body before knocking her on the head with the back of a machete,” he said in a statement today

    According to Cha, the police received information about the getaway vehicle found in a residential alley in Taman Desawan, Klang, however, when the police arrived at the location, all the suspects had fled

    "The police are still tracking down the suspects involved, so those who have information about this incident are urged to contact Klang Selatan district police headquarters at 03-33762222 or any nearby police station," he added

    ['police', 'five', 'suspect', 'family', 'machete']



  • MUHYIDDIN SAYS MACC DIDN'T QUESTION HIM AS A SUSPECT IN COVID-19 STIMULUS AID INVESTIGATION

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2023/02/18/muhyiddin-says-macc-didnt-question-him-as-a-suspect-in-covid-19-stimulus-aid-investigation/55571

    02/18/2023, 16:09

    57.14% Shortened!

    “I explained to the MACC that I have all the papers to prove what went on

    “The MACC investigating officer then read out the names of the companies but I did not recognise them

    “The MACC officer informed me that I was not a suspect but was called in merely to give explanations in the process of investigations,” Muhyiddin, who was prime minister from March 2020 to August 2021, was quoted as saying by The Star after launching a blood-donation campaign at the Mid Valley Megamall here

    He told reporters that it will be up to MACC to get further information from Tengku Zafrul, who was finance minister in Muhyiddin’s Cabinet

    MACC froze Bersatu’s bank accounts at the end of last month

    On February 10, MACC was reported to be scrutinising the award of a RM1.2 billion government immigration contract to an IT company owned by the son-in-law of an unnamed former prime minister back in May 2022.

    ['prime', 'minister', 'muhyiddin', 'say', 'company']

  • UNHCR, FAMILY FRONTIERS LAUD PUTRAJAYA’S MOVE TO CONFER AUTOMATIC CITIZENSHIP TO CHILDREN BORN ABROAD TO MALAYSIAN MUMS

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2023/02/18/unhcr-family-frontiers-laud-putrajayas-move-to-confer-automatic-citizenship-to-children-born-abroad-to-malaysian-mums/55573

    02/18/2023, 16:08

    73.91% Shortened!

    Local advocacy group Family Frontiers and the Malaysian chapter of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR Malaysia) were swift in commending the Cabinet for agreeing to amend the Federal Constitution so that children born abroad to Malaysian mothers can gain automatic Malaysian citizenship

    Malaysia has for decades been stuck with citizenship laws that were seen as unfair and discriminatory against women, as the Federal Constitution only granted automatic Malaysian citizenship to children born overseas to Malaysian men with foreign wives, but not Malaysian women with foreign husbands

    Some Malaysian mothers were not able to fly back to Malaysia to give birth due to high-risk pregnancies or did not even know the government would reject Malaysian citizenship for their children just because they were born abroad

    There is also the risk of Malaysian mothers' overseas-born children ending up stateless, such as in the case of Mashithah Abdul Halim whose youngest child is stateless or without citizenship from any country

    Today, Family Frontiers thanked the Cabinet and welcomed its decision to bring the proposed legal changes to Parliament to allow Malaysian mothers the right to confer citizenship on their overseas-born children on the same basis as Malaysian fathers, calling this a "significant step forward"

    Family Frontiers president Suriani Kempe said the Malaysian mothers are awaiting for the Malaysian government to table the proposed changes to the Federal Constitution's citizenship laws

    ['law', 'citizenship', 'malaysian', 'child', 'family']

    Local advocacy group Family Frontiers and the Malaysian chapter of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR Malaysia) were swift in commending the Cabinet for agreeing to amend the Federal Constitution so that children born abroad to Malaysian mothers can gain automatic Malaysian citizenship

    Malaysia has for decades been stuck with citizenship laws that were seen as unfair and discriminatory against women, as the Federal Constitution only granted automatic Malaysian citizenship to children born overseas to Malaysian men with foreign wives, but not Malaysian women with foreign husbands

    Some Malaysian mothers were not able to fly back to Malaysia to give birth due to high-risk pregnancies or did not even know the government would reject Malaysian citizenship for their children just because they were born abroad

    There is also the risk of Malaysian mothers' overseas-born children ending up stateless, such as in the case of Mashithah Abdul Halim whose youngest child is stateless or without citizenship from any country

    Today, Family Frontiers thanked the Cabinet and welcomed its decision to bring the proposed legal changes to Parliament to allow Malaysian mothers the right to confer citizenship on their overseas-born children on the same basis as Malaysian fathers, calling this a "significant step forward"

    Family Frontiers president Suriani Kempe said the Malaysian mothers are awaiting for the Malaysian government to table the proposed changes to the Federal Constitution's citizenship laws

    ['law', 'citizenship', 'malaysian', 'child', 'family']

  • MALAYSIAN OPERATORS READY TO WELCOME BIG SPENDING CHINA TOURISTS SEEKING TAILORED TOURS POST-COVID, AND IN TRAVEL GROUPS UNDER 20

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2023/02/18/malaysian-operators-ready-to-welcome-big-spending-china-tourists-seeking-tailored-tours-post-covid-and-in-travel-groups-under-20/55567

    02/18/2023, 15:08

    62.5% Shortened!

    Based on the inquiries made to Mita's members, Uzaidi was reported saying that Malaysia estimates one million tourist arrivals from China who are expected to spend RM1.5 billion (US$341 million) in the country

    Tourism is a key source of income in Malaysia and accounted for 6.8 per cent of the country's gross domestic product (GDP) in 2019

    A check by Malay Mail of Tourism Malaysia's figures showed that Malaysia had enjoyed as many as 26.7 million international tourists arrivals in 2016, followed by 25.9 million (2017), 25.8 million (2018), 26.1 million (2019), but that this slowed down during the pandemic to just 4.3 million in 2020 and 134,728 in 2021

    Tourism Malaysia's data showed Malaysia also saw its international tourists spending around RM82 billion here in 2016 and 2017, RM84.1 billion in 2018 and RM86.1 billion in 2019, before it plunged to over RM12.68 billion in 2020 and RM238.7 million in 2021

    Tourists from China to Malaysia once numbered 3.1 million in 2019, but fell to 405,149 in 2020, and only 7,701 in 2021, the latest publicly-available Tourism Malaysia data showed

    China tourists accounted for RM15.3 billion of the total RM86.1 billion tourist receipts for Malaysia in 2019

    ['tourist', 'china', 'malaysia', 'tourism', 'say']

  • TWITTER TO CHARGE USERS TO SECURE ACCOUNTS VIA TEXT MESSAGE

    https://www.channelnewsasia.com/business/twitter-charge-2fa-text-messages-secure-accounts-paid-subscribers-3287906

    02/18/2023, 12:08

    57.14% Shortened!

    Figurines with smartphones and computers are seen in front of the Twitter logo in this illustration, Nov 28, 2022

    After Mar 20, "only Twitter Blue subscribers will be able to use text messages as their two-factor authentication method", the company tweeted

    Two-factor authentication, meant to make accounts more secure, requires an account holder to use a second authentication method in addition to a password

    Twitter allows 2FA by text message, authentication app and a security key

    Last month, Twitter said it would price Twitter Blue subscription for Android at US$11 per month, the same as for iOS subscribers.

    By clicking subscribe, I agree to receive news updates and promotional material from Mediacorp and Mediacorp's partners.

    ['twitter', 'use', 'authentication', '2fa', 'account']

  • TURKIYE FINDS NEW SURVIVOR NEARLY 12 DAYS AFTER QUAKE

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/world/2023/02/18/turkiye-finds-new-survivor-nearly-12-days-after-quake/55540

    02/18/2023, 12:08

    50.0% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise ANTAKYA, Feb 18 — Turkish rescuers yesterday pulled a 45-year-old man from rubble nearly 12 days after a devastating quake claimed tens of thousands of lives

    The man, Hakan Yasinoglu, was rescued 278 hours after the 7.8-magnitude tremor in badly hit Hatay, a southern province near the Syrian border

    Three other people were rescued late Thursday and early yesterday morning, including a 14-year-old boy, with the search at some sites continuing around the clock

    Turkish Vice President Fuat Oktay yesterday said rescue efforts continued at fewer than 200 sites in the region

    The tremor struck 11 provinces in Turkiye

    Turkish officials have said rescue efforts in three provinces, Adana, Kilis and Sanliurfa, have been completed

    ['turkish', 'rescuer', 'yesterday', 'year', 'old']

    About Us Advertise ANTAKYA, Feb 18 — Turkish rescuers yesterday pulled a 45-year-old man from rubble nearly 12 days after a devastating quake claimed tens of thousands of lives

    The man, Hakan Yasinoglu, was rescued 278 hours after the 7.8-magnitude tremor in badly hit Hatay, a southern province near the Syrian border

    Three other people were rescued late Thursday and early yesterday morning, including a 14-year-old boy, with the search at some sites continuing around the clock

    Turkish Vice President Fuat Oktay yesterday said rescue efforts continued at fewer than 200 sites in the region

    The tremor struck 11 provinces in Turkiye

    Turkish officials have said rescue efforts in three provinces, Adana, Kilis and Sanliurfa, have been completed

  • CHECK WITH KADI'S OFFICE BEFORE ORGANISING RELIGIOUS, CULTURAL ACTIVITIES, JOHOR MUSLIMS URGED

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/02/18/check-with-kadi039s-office-before-organising-religious-cultural-activities-johor-muslims-urged

    02/18/2023, 12:08

    60.0% Shortened!

    Saturday, 18 Feb 2023

    JOHOR BAHRU, 26 Mac -- Pengerusi Jawatankuasa Hal Ehwal Agama Islam negeri Johor Mohd Fared Mohd Khalid (Semerah) pada majlis mengangkat sumpah jawatan Ahli Majlis Mesyuarat Kerajaan Negeri Johor di Balai Menghadap, Istana Bukit Serene hari ini.

    State Islamic Religious Affairs Committee chairman Mohd Fared Mohd Khalid (pic) said a review needs to be done earlier in efforts to preserve the culture and prevent it from turning into activities that could affect religious beliefs

    Earlier, a viral video on the TikTok application showed a ‘kuda kepang’ performance believed to have taken place in Johor which is believed to involve elements of worship and possession

    The Johor Fatwa Committee had issued a fatwa on Feb 18, 2000 making it illegal for Muslims to participate in Kuda Kepang performances as they contain elements of worship and possession

    Mohd Fared Mohd Khalid

    ['johor', 'mohd', 'religious', 'activity', 'kuda']

    Saturday, 18 Feb 2023

    JOHOR BAHRU, 26 Mac -- Pengerusi Jawatankuasa Hal Ehwal Agama Islam negeri Johor Mohd Fared Mohd Khalid (Semerah) pada majlis mengangkat sumpah jawatan Ahli Majlis Mesyuarat Kerajaan Negeri Johor di Balai Menghadap, Istana Bukit Serene hari ini.

    State Islamic Religious Affairs Committee chairman Mohd Fared Mohd Khalid (pic) said a review needs to be done earlier in efforts to preserve the culture and prevent it from turning into activities that could affect religious beliefs

    Earlier, a viral video on the TikTok application showed a ‘kuda kepang’ performance believed to have taken place in Johor which is believed to involve elements of worship and possession

    The Johor Fatwa Committee had issued a fatwa on Feb 18, 2000 making it illegal for Muslims to participate in Kuda Kepang performances as they contain elements of worship and possession

    Mohd Fared Mohd Khalid

    ['johor', 'mohd', 'religious', 'activity', 'kuda']



  • FIVE HONG KONG TV AND RADIO STATIONS MUST AIR 30 MINUTES EACH WEEK ON NATIONAL IDENTITY, SECURITY, BUT WILL PEOPLE TUNE IN?

    https://www.thestar.com.my/aseanplus/aseanplus-news/2023/02/18/five-hong-kong-tv-and-radio-stations-must-air-30-minutes-each-week-on-national-identity-security-but-will-people-tune-in

    02/18/2023, 12:08

    77.78% Shortened!

    Under the new rules, the licensee should provide “no less than 30 minutes of programmes” on national education, national identity and national security law every week, on top of the existing required broadcast hours of current affairs programmes

    “But the question is whether it can get the results the government wants to see

    “Sometimes, you cannot teach people to be patriotic or identify with their country

    Back in 2008 when there was the Beijing Olympics, Hong Kong people identified very much with the country and Chinese astronauts were seen as heroes when they visited Hong Kong,” he said

    But Elizabeth Quat, a lawmaker with the pro-Beijing Democratic Alliance for the Betterment and Progress of Hong Kong, argued TV operators had a social responsibility to help the public understand government policies

    “So, it cannot be said to be unfair.” Under Article 9 of the national security law introduced in 2020, the Hong Kong government has a duty to “promote national security education in schools and universities and through social organisations, the media, the internet” and other means

    ['hong', 'kong', 'radio', 'national', 'government']

    Under the new rules, the licensee should provide “no less than 30 minutes of programmes” on national education, national identity and national security law every week, on top of the existing required broadcast hours of current affairs programmes

    “Sometimes, you cannot teach people to be patriotic or identify with their country

  • SINGAPORE HEALTH MINISTRY RECORDS FIRST DEATH LINKED TO COVID-19 VACCINATION AFTER MAN DIED FROM HEART INFLAMMATION POST-JAB

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/singapore/2023/02/18/singapore-health-ministry-records-first-death-linked-to-covid-19-vaccination-after-man-died-from-heart-inflammation-post-jab/55528

    02/18/2023, 11:08

    57.14% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise SINGAPORE, Feb18 — Singapore has recorded its first Covid-19 vaccine-related death after the Ministry of Health (MOH) announced yesterday that a 28-year-old Bangladeshi man likely died due to a vaccination against the coronavirus

    The coroner also found that on the balance of probabilities, it was “likely to be related to Covid-19 vaccination”, MOH said without naming the deceased

    Under the ministry’s Vaccine Injury Financial Assistance Programme, a one-time financial aid of S$225,000 (RM 745,793.13) will be extended to the man’s family

    “MOH is working with the Ministry of Manpower to extend assistance to his family and facilitate their application,” MOH added

    It also said that to date, more than 17 million doses of Covid-19 vaccine have been administered in Singapore through the national vaccination programme and this is “the first death related to Covid-19 vaccination locally”

    “This will enable early diagnosis and appropriate medical management of any rare severe adverse events that may occur after vaccination.” MOH said that along with the expert committee on Covid-19 vaccination and HSA, it will continue to monitor vaccine-related serious adverse events closely

    ['covid', 'vaccine', 'related', 'death', 'ministry']

    About Us Advertise SINGAPORE, Feb18 — Singapore has recorded its first Covid-19 vaccine-related death after the Ministry of Health (MOH) announced yesterday that a 28-year-old Bangladeshi man likely died due to a vaccination against the coronavirus

    The coroner also found that on the balance of probabilities, it was “likely to be related to Covid-19 vaccination”, MOH said without naming the deceased

    Under the ministry’s Vaccine Injury Financial Assistance Programme, a one-time financial aid of S$225,000 (RM 745,793.13) will be extended to the man’s family

    “MOH is working with the Ministry of Manpower to extend assistance to his family and facilitate their application,” MOH added

    It also said that to date, more than 17 million doses of Covid-19 vaccine have been administered in Singapore through the national vaccination programme and this is “the first death related to Covid-19 vaccination locally”

    “This will enable early diagnosis and appropriate medical management of any rare severe adverse events that may occur after vaccination.” MOH said that along with the expert committee on Covid-19 vaccination and HSA, it will continue to monitor vaccine-related serious adverse events closely

  • ANWAR CABINET AGREES TO ENABLE AUTOMATIC CITIZENSHIP FOR CHILDREN BORN OVERSEAS TO MALAYSIAN MUMS

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2023/02/18/anwar-cabinet-agrees-to-enable-automatic-citizenship-for-children-born-overseas-to-malaysian-mums/55523

    02/18/2023, 10:08

    76.92% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Feb 18 — The Cabinet has agreed to amend the Federal Constitution to enable children born abroad to Malaysian mothers to gain automatic Malaysian citizenship

    The Federal Constitution currently only provides automatic citizenship for children born overseas to Malaysian fathers, while Malaysian mothers are required to apply for their overseas-born children to be registered as Malaysian citizens with no guarantee of success

    The only difference for such overseas-born children is whether their Malaysian parent is a father or mother

    This is despite an amendment to Article 8(2) of the Federal Constitution in September 2001 to stop gender discrimination

    Six Malaysian mothers and advocacy group Family Frontiers on December 18, 2020 launched a legal challenge against the discrimination against women in the current citizenship laws in the Federal Constitution which were depriving their overseas-born children of automatic Malaysian citizenship

    The Malaysian mothers and Family Frontiers on September 9, 2021 succeeded at the High Court which ruled that their overseas-born children are also entitled to Malaysian citizenship, but the Malaysian government on August 5, 2022 won its appeal in a 2-1 decision at the Court of Appeal

    ['federal', 'constitution', 'child', 'born', 'malaysian']

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Feb 18 — The Cabinet has agreed to amend the Federal Constitution to enable children born abroad to Malaysian mothers to gain automatic Malaysian citizenship

    The Federal Constitution currently only provides automatic citizenship for children born overseas to Malaysian fathers, while Malaysian mothers are required to apply for their overseas-born children to be registered as Malaysian citizens with no guarantee of success

    The only difference for such overseas-born children is whether their Malaysian parent is a father or mother

    This is despite an amendment to Article 8(2) of the Federal Constitution in September 2001 to stop gender discrimination

    Six Malaysian mothers and advocacy group Family Frontiers on December 18, 2020 launched a legal challenge against the discrimination against women in the current citizenship laws in the Federal Constitution which were depriving their overseas-born children of automatic Malaysian citizenship

    The Malaysian mothers and Family Frontiers on September 9, 2021 succeeded at the High Court which ruled that their overseas-born children are also entitled to Malaysian citizenship, but the Malaysian government on August 5, 2022 won its appeal in a 2-1 decision at the Court of Appeal

    ['federal', 'constitution', 'child', 'born', 'malaysian']

  • KAPAR MP'S MENU RAHMAH COMMENT AN INSULT TO PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES, SAYS RAS ADIBA

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/02/18/kapar-mp039s-menu-rahmah-comment-an-insult-to-people-with-disabilities-says-ras-adiba

    02/18/2023, 10:08

    60.0% Shortened!

    She added that Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) is a neurological disability that causes problems in language, behavioural and speech development involving children and is not a physical disease

    Ras Adiba said that autism can be identified at the early stages of a child’s development by their own parents and is usually diagnosed around the ages of 1 to 3, and being quite significant as children reach the age of six

    Some factors that can cause autism include genetic features, family history of autism, the mother’s age and physical condition during pregnancy, complications during pregnancy and birth as well as infections during pregnancy

    Ras Adiba said the World Health Organisation (WHO) estimates that one out of 100 children globally has autism and added that Social Welfare Department statistics show that as of June 30, 2022, a total of 36,601 individuals in Malaysia have been confirmed to have autism and 24,748 of them are below 12

    "Therefore, I urge that the Health Ministry and the Women, Family and Community Development Ministry immediately establish a National Autism Council, while the Clinical Autism Registration Department should introduce a mandatory reporting of autism cases in Malaysia

    "Also, Subfertility Clinics under the National Population and Family Development Board should be involved in tackling autism at birth and to expand the number of High Functioning Autism Rehabilitation within Community Centres nationwide to develop the potential of autistic children,” she said

    ['statement', 'halimah', 'ali', 'health', 'autism']

    She added that Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) is a neurological disability that causes problems in language, behavioural and speech development involving children and is not a physical disease

    Ras Adiba said that autism can be identified at the early stages of a child’s development by their own parents and is usually diagnosed around the ages of 1 to 3, and being quite significant as children reach the age of six

    Some factors that can cause autism include genetic features, family history of autism, the mother’s age and physical condition during pregnancy, complications during pregnancy and birth as well as infections during pregnancy

    Ras Adiba said the World Health Organisation (WHO) estimates that one out of 100 children globally has autism and added that Social Welfare Department statistics show that as of June 30, 2022, a total of 36,601 individuals in Malaysia have been confirmed to have autism and 24,748 of them are below 12

    "Therefore, I urge that the Health Ministry and the Women, Family and Community Development Ministry immediately establish a National Autism Council, while the Clinical Autism Registration Department should introduce a mandatory reporting of autism cases in Malaysia

    "Also, Subfertility Clinics under the National Population and Family Development Board should be involved in tackling autism at birth and to expand the number of High Functioning Autism Rehabilitation within Community Centres nationwide to develop the potential of autistic children,” she said

    ['statement', 'halimah', 'ali', 'health', 'autism']

    United are also set to face Newcastle in the League Cup final at Wembley on February 26

  • JÜRGEN KLOPP CAN FINALLY UNLEASH BORUSSIA DORTMUND PLAN AT LIVERPOOL AND LUIS DÍAZ WILL THRIVE

    https://www.liverpool.com/liverpool-fc-news/features/diaz-liverpool-klopp-borussia-dortmund-26261883

    02/18/2023, 09:08

    73.91% Shortened!

    After recovering from his injury, Luis Díaz is approaching a return to action for Liverpool, and Jürgen Klopp could use 4-2-3-1 as a means of accommodating him

    Sign up to receive the best LFC opinion direct to your inbox We have more newsletters People still haven't forgotten about Jürgen Klopp's Borussia Dortmund outfit

    Under Klopp, BVB won the Bundesliga on two consecutive occasions while also reaching a Champions League final in 2013

    It was highly effective, but 4-3-3 has been in place throughout his time at Liverpool

    It has worked for many years, with Liverpool securing a countless number of trophies, from the Premier League to the Champions League and all of the rest, but Klopp's squad dynamic is changing

    Klopp will have heavy competition for offensive places once his number 23 returns, which is why 4-2-3-1 could be considered

    ['return', 'liverpool', 'rgen', 'klopp', 'could']

    After recovering from his injury, Luis Díaz is approaching a return to action for Liverpool, and Jürgen Klopp could use 4-2-3-1 as a means of accommodating him

    Sign up to receive the best LFC opinion direct to your inbox We have more newsletters People still haven't forgotten about Jürgen Klopp's Borussia Dortmund outfit

    Under Klopp, BVB won the Bundesliga on two consecutive occasions while also reaching a Champions League final in 2013

    It was highly effective, but 4-3-3 has been in place throughout his time at Liverpool

    It has worked for many years, with Liverpool securing a countless number of trophies, from the Premier League to the Champions League and all of the rest, but Klopp's squad dynamic is changing

    Klopp will have heavy competition for offensive places once his number 23 returns, which is why 4-2-3-1 could be considered

    ['return', 'liverpool', 'rgen', 'klopp', 'could']

    CEO John Yao even asked his Facebook followers whether he should purchase an MLBB team

    Moonton has not only disclosed the participating teams for the upcoming season, but also announced that the regular season will take place offline at Stadium Juara in Kuala Lumpur

    The new season of MPL Malaysia is set to commence on March 10 and will feature various changes such as a decrease in the regular season’s duration from eight weeks to six

  • COVID-19 WATCH: 241 NEW CASES, SAYS HEALTH MINISTRY

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/02/18/covid-19-watch-241-new-cases-says-health-ministry

    02/18/2023, 09:08

    45.45% Shortened!

    Saturday, 18 Feb 2023

    The Health Ministry said through data released on its KKMNow portal on Saturday (Feb 18) that this brings the new total to 5,040,609 cases since the pandemic began

    Of the 241, there is one imported case and the remaining 240 are local

    The ministry also said through its KKMNow portal that there were 235 recoveries on Friday bringing the total number of active cases in Malaysia to 9,405

    Out of the nine, three in ICU require ventilator support.

    Thank you for your report! Copyright © 1995-

    "The recent market rally off the lows has certainly been impressive, but I think excessive," Chief Market Strategist David Keller at StockCharts told Investing.com's Yasin Ebrahim in an interview on Wednesday

  • TECH GIANT GOOGLE LAYS OFF EMPLOYEES AT SINGAPORE OFFICE AS PART OF GLOBAL CUTS

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/singapore/2023/02/18/tech-giant-google-lays-off-employees-at-singapore-office-as-part-of-global-cuts/55518

    02/18/2023, 09:08

    57.14% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise SINGAPORE, Feb 18 — Google Singapore yesterday confirmed that it has laid off an unspecified number of employees at its Singapore office, a day after the global technology giant’s India office retrenched more than 450 staff members

    In response to queries from TODAY, Google Singapore said that the firm is “unable to share the number of employees impacted in Singapore”, but said that the workers are “part of the 12,000 roles affected globally as previously announced”

    Google Singapore added yesterday that Google will “support employees in line with local practices as they look for their next opportunity”

    Checks by TODAY on professional networking site LinkedIn showed that several laid-off and retained Google Singapore staff members had made mention of the retrenchment exercise

    One claimed that the number of layoffs in Singapore was 190 employees but TODAY has not been able to verify that figure

    The Singapore Ministry of Manpower said last November that 1,270 workers were laid off in the Singapore tech sector between July and November last year

    ['singapore', 'google', 'employee', 'today', 'say']

    About Us Advertise SINGAPORE, Feb 18 — Google Singapore yesterday confirmed that it has laid off an unspecified number of employees at its Singapore office, a day after the global technology giant’s India office retrenched more than 450 staff members

    In response to queries from TODAY, Google Singapore said that the firm is “unable to share the number of employees impacted in Singapore”, but said that the workers are “part of the 12,000 roles affected globally as previously announced”

    One claimed that the number of layoffs in Singapore was 190 employees but TODAY has not been able to verify that figure

    The Singapore Ministry of Manpower said last November that 1,270 workers were laid off in the Singapore tech sector between July and November last year

  • MALAYSIA FALL TO CHINA AS BADMINTON ASIA MIXED TEAM CHAMPIONSHIP QUARTER-FINAL JINX STRIKES AGAIN

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/sports/2023/02/18/malaysia-fall-to-china-as-badminton-asia-mixed-team-championship-quarter-final-jinx-strikes-again/55507

    02/18/2023, 08:08

    50.0% Shortened!

    But defending champions China drew level when world number 101 women’s singles shuttler Gao Fang Jie fought back from a game down to stun two-time world junior champion Goh Jin Wei 15-21, 21-13, 21-19 after a titanic 70-minute battle

    Malaysia, however, were thrown a lifeline by world number five women’s doubles pair Pearly Tan-M

    But China, despite playing without their top stars, were not to be denied as they clinched the winning point courtesy of world number 110 Feng Yan Zhe-Huang Dong Ping’s stunning 21-15, 25-23 win over Malaysia’s world number six Tan Kian Meng-Lai Pei Jing in mixed doubles

    In today’s semi-finals, China will take on India, who ousted Hong Kong 3-2 in the other quarter-final tie, and South Korea will square up against Thailand

    Malaysia have never gone past the quarter-finals in the BAMTC, having crashed out the last eight in the first edition in 2017 in Hanoi, Vietnam and the 2019 edition in Hong Kong

    The 2021 edition in Wuhan, China was cancelled due to the Covid-19 pandemic

    ['malaysia', 'quarter', 'final', 'china', 'champion']

  • BINANCE’S US PARTNER CONFIRMS FIRM RUN BY CEO ZHAO OPERATED ON EXCHANGE

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/money/2023/02/18/binances-us-partner-confirms-firm-run-by-ceo-zhao-operated-on-exchange/55508

    02/18/2023, 08:08

    73.91% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise LONDON, Feb 18 — The US partner of global cryptocurrency exchange Binance has confirmed that a trading firm managed by Binance CEO Zhao Changpeng operated as a market maker on its platform

    Reuters reported on Thursday, citing banking records and company messages, that Binance had secret access to a bank account belonging to its purportedly independent US partner and transferred large sums of money from the account to the trading firm, Merit Peak Ltd “While there was a market making firm named Merit Peak that operated on the Binance.US platform, it stopped all activity on the platform in 2021,” Binance.US said in a tweet on Thursday after the Reuters story was published

    The global Binance exchange is not licensed to operate in the United States but the transfers to Merit Peak revealed by Reuters suggest that Binance controlled the finances of Binance.US, despite saying publicly that the American entity is “fully independent” and operates as its “US partner.” Binance transferred over US$400 million from the account at California-based Silvergate Bank to Merit Peak between January and March of 2021, Reuters reported on Thursday

    Before that story’s publication, Binance.US had told Reuters that “Merit Peak is neither trading nor providing any kind of services on the Binance.US platform,” without giving further details

    A spokesperson for the global Binance exchange, which did not respond to Reuters’ questions for the story on Thursday, told crypto news outlet CoinDesk that the transfers were “a Binance.US issue.” Zhao, the Binance CEO, said yesterday that the global exchange has pulled back on potential investments in the United States, a move that comes amid growing scrutiny by US regulators of crypto companies so far this year

    They fell sharply on the Reuters report on Thursday, losing more than 22 per cent

    ['exchange', 'binance', 'trading', 'firm', 'reuters']

    About Us Advertise LONDON, Feb 18 — The US partner of global cryptocurrency exchange Binance has confirmed that a trading firm managed by Binance CEO Zhao Changpeng operated as a market maker on its platform

    Reuters reported on Thursday, citing banking records and company messages, that Binance had secret access to a bank account belonging to its purportedly independent US partner and transferred large sums of money from the account to the trading firm, Merit Peak Ltd “While there was a market making firm named Merit Peak that operated on the Binance.US platform, it stopped all activity on the platform in 2021,” Binance.US said in a tweet on Thursday after the Reuters story was published

    The global Binance exchange is not licensed to operate in the United States but the transfers to Merit Peak revealed by Reuters suggest that Binance controlled the finances of Binance.US, despite saying publicly that the American entity is “fully independent” and operates as its “US partner.” Binance transferred over US$400 million from the account at California-based Silvergate Bank to Merit Peak between January and March of 2021, Reuters reported on Thursday

    Before that story’s publication, Binance.US had told Reuters that “Merit Peak is neither trading nor providing any kind of services on the Binance.US platform,” without giving further details

    They fell sharply on the Reuters report on Thursday, losing more than 22 per cent

    ['exchange', 'binance', 'trading', 'firm', 'reuters']



  • STORM DEATH TOLL RISES IN NZ

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/world/2023/02/18/storm-death-toll-rises-in-nz

    02/18/2023, 08:08

    60.0% Shortened!

    The storm has faded into the South Pacific but left a trail of destruction and human suffering across New Zealand’s North Island

    Police yesterday confirmed an eighth death as a result of the storm, saying “the person is believed to have died after being caught in flood water”

    Collins, her husband and their two kids were trapped in their one-storey home in the hard-hit Hawke’s Bay region when the floodwaters arrived

    “The water was about 10cm from the ceiling in our house and rose extremely quickly and violently,” Collins wrote in a Facebook post on Thursday

    In the chaos, two-and-a-half-year-old Ivy was swept away and drowned

    Thank you for your report! Copyright © 1995-

  • YOURSAY | MINISTER'S REMARKS ON EDUCATION MERELY 'SYIOK SENDIRI'

    https://www.malaysiakini.com/news/655516

    02/18/2023, 08:08

    87.23% Shortened!

    Why doom? For the main pillar holding this nation and even in the future will be how qualified our future citizens are, especially in education

    Instead of saying there is room for improvement, Education Minister Fadhlina Sidek is saying that we are on par with Singapore and Japan

    We are very far from Singapore’s and Japan’s levels in quality of education

    The Education Ministry rushed to change the primary school syllabus a few years ago to make it tougher and to improve the country’s Pisa ranking

    The education ministry was very upset as it affected the national image

    The teacher said the ministry gradually upgraded the Maths and Science Year 5 syllabus to be used for Year 4, Year 6 became that of Year 5 and the Form 1 syllabus was taught to Year 6 students

    “Malaysia is of the view that any attempt to protect the environment should not be at the expense of our economy,” he added

    “For Malaysia and Asean, we take the position of peace and neutrality,” he added

    Steinmeier, who is in Malaysia for a three-day official visit, heads to Sarawak today

    The last state visit to Malaysia by a German president was 26 years ago in April 1997

    Germany is Malaysia’s largest trading partner from the EU

    75.0% Shortened!

    MIKEL ARTETA has declared Arsenal the People’s Champions and claims most of the country wants them to win the title

    Yet Arteta is convinced that most people still want his team to win and is determined to tap into that public support

    “Before this season, if you had to bet your house on one team, I don’t think a lot of people would have put their money on us

    “We have not had many situations to win the title recently, but we want to be in the mix

    And now Arteta fears his team could pay the price as they look to end a run of four games without a win

  • HALF THE WORLD TO DUMP U.S. DOLLARS IN FUTURE, CAUSING 'TSUNAMI OF INFLATION' AND ASSET PRICE 'COLLAPSE', PAVING THE WAY FOR CBDCS AND THE GREAT RESET - ANDY SCHECTMAN

    https://www.kitco.com/news/2023-02-17/Half-the-world-to-dump-U-S-dollars-in-future-causing-tsunami-of-inflation-and-asset-price-collapse-paving-the-way-for-CBDCs-and-The-Great-Reset-Andy-Schectman.html

    02/18/2023, 07:08

    73.91% Shortened!

    Schectman, who has three decades of experience in the precious metals sector, said that the BRICS (Brazil, Russia, India, China, and South Africa) coalition could lead the charge to develop their own reserve currency which would compete against the U.S

    “The BRICS are, I think, coalescing against the dollar, the perceived hypocrisy and hegemony of the dollar,” he said

    “All it would take [for de-dollarization] would be for Saudi Arabia to stand up on the stage… [and say,] we’re now going to consider taking up other currencies for oil,” he claimed

    And if they all start to dump dollars, and I think it would happen quickly, you would have a tsunami of inflation hitting the shores of the West.” To find out why oil is so important to Schectman’s thesis, watch the video above CBDCs and The Great Reset As dollars return to the United States, this “would immediately create a spike in interest rates to compensate for the loss of purchasing power,” said Schectman

    “That’s when they would come in and roll out their new CBDC,” he forecast

    “She [Brainard] wants to do modern monetary policy directly to your iPhone,” Schectman claimed

    ['follow', 'kitco', 'dollar', 'currency', 'would']

    Under the focus area of rakyat welfare, Dr Wee said the Budget should focus on creating job opportunities

  • SOCCER-MASON LEAVES REFEREES' BODY AFTER VAR ERROR IN ARSENAL GAME

    https://www.thestar.com.my/sport/football/2023/02/18/soccer-mason-leaves-referees039-body-after-var-error-in-arsenal-game

    02/18/2023, 07:08

    60.0% Shortened!

    Saturday, 18 Feb 2023

    (Reuters) - Lee Mason has left the referees' body PGMOL by mutual agreement after making a mistake as the Video Assistant Referee in last weekend's 1-1 Premier League draw between Arsenal and Brentford, Professional Game Match Officials Limited said on Friday

    PGMOL said later on Sunday that the decisions which went against both Arsenal and also Brighton & Hove Albion in Saturday's league matches were down to "human error"

    "PGMOL can confirm that Video Assistant Referee Lee Mason has departed the organisation by mutual consent," the referees body said in a statement on Friday

    Mason, a Premier League referee for 15 years, oversaw 287 top-flight matches during that time, with his last coming in the closing stages of the 2021-22 season

    "His full career in the professional game saw the 51-year-old officiate in over 500 fixtures after he progressed to the Football League in 1998," PGMOL said

    ['league', 'brighton', 'referee', 'mason', 'pgmol']

    Saturday, 18 Feb 2023

    (Reuters) - Lee Mason has left the referees' body PGMOL by mutual agreement after making a mistake as the Video Assistant Referee in last weekend's 1-1 Premier League draw between Arsenal and Brentford, Professional Game Match Officials Limited said on Friday

    PGMOL said later on Sunday that the decisions which went against both Arsenal and also Brighton & Hove Albion in Saturday's league matches were down to "human error"

    "PGMOL can confirm that Video Assistant Referee Lee Mason has departed the organisation by mutual consent," the referees body said in a statement on Friday

    Mason, a Premier League referee for 15 years, oversaw 287 top-flight matches during that time, with his last coming in the closing stages of the 2021-22 season

    "His full career in the professional game saw the 51-year-old officiate in over 500 fixtures after he progressed to the Football League in 1998," PGMOL said

    ['league', 'brighton', 'referee', 'mason', 'pgmol']
