  • INDIA'S HAL IN TALKS ON TEJAS FIGHTER JET EXPORTS, FACES MALAYSIA SETBACK

    https://www.reuters.com/business/aerospace-defense/indias-hal-talks-with-four-countries-export-tejas-fighter-jets-2023-02-14/

    02/14/2023, 19:08

    75.0% Shortened!

    Malaysia has shortlisted the Tejas light fighter jet for an order of around 16 planes, and Argentina, Egypt and Botswana have also expressed interest, HAL Chairman and Managing Director C B Ananthakrishnan told reporters at a conference during Aero India, the country's biggest aviation event

    View 2 more stories HAL is targeting export sales of 25 billion Indian rupees ($302.15 million) over the next few years, its director of operations Jayadeva EP told Reuters

    The Indian government in 2021 gave a $6 billion contract to HAL for 83 of the locally produced Tejas jets for delivery starting around 2023 - four decades after the design began in 1983

    The Tejas has been beset by design and other challenges, and was once rejected by the Indian Navy as too heavy

    HAL plans to use the General Electric (GE.N) manufactured 414 engine on a second generation of light-combat aircraft, Ananthakrishnan said, adding it was in talks to produce those engines in India

    Reuters, the news and media division of Thomson Reuters, is the world’s largest multimedia news provider, reaching billions of people worldwide every day

    ['reuters', 'india', 'light', 'say', 'tejas']

    Malaysia has shortlisted the Tejas light fighter jet for an order of around 16 planes, and Argentina, Egypt and Botswana have also expressed interest, HAL Chairman and Managing Director C B Ananthakrishnan told reporters at a conference during Aero India, the country's biggest aviation event

    View 2 more stories HAL is targeting export sales of 25 billion Indian rupees ($302.15 million) over the next few years, its director of operations Jayadeva EP told Reuters

    The Indian government in 2021 gave a $6 billion contract to HAL for 83 of the locally produced Tejas jets for delivery starting around 2023 - four decades after the design began in 1983

    The Tejas has been beset by design and other challenges, and was once rejected by the Indian Navy as too heavy

    HAL plans to use the General Electric (GE.N) manufactured 414 engine on a second generation of light-combat aircraft, Ananthakrishnan said, adding it was in talks to produce those engines in India

    Reuters, the news and media division of Thomson Reuters, is the world’s largest multimedia news provider, reaching billions of people worldwide every day

    ['reuters', 'india', 'light', 'say', 'tejas']

    He said this at an event to accept donations for the Disaster Fund, to be channeled to Turkiye and Syria

  • THAILAND TO IMPOSE RM39 ENTRY FEE FOR FOREIGN TRAVELLERS FROM JUNE AS TOURISM BOOMS

    https://www.thestar.com.my/aseanplus/aseanplus-news/2023/02/14/thailand-to-impose-rm39-entry-fee-for-foreign-travellers-from-june-as-tourism-booms

    02/14/2023, 19:08

    62.5% Shortened!

    Tuesday, 14 Feb 2023

    The entry fee, widely criticized by local tourism industry, comes as the nation famed for its Buddhist temples, beaches and national parks is witnessing a rush in tourist arrivals that’s gained momentum with the abolition of pandemic-era curbs and China’s move to end it Zero-Covid policy

    Foreign tourist arrivals may reach as high as 30 million this year, almost tripling from 11.2 million last year, according to some estimates

    Thailand has for long mooted an entry fee for foreign travelers but its implementation was delayed by the pandemic

    A part of the fee will help fund the development of local tourist attractions, Phiphat said

    The levy will be added to air ticket prices, while the method of collections from entry by land has yet to be determined, the government said last year

    ['thailand', 'entry', 'fee', 'foreign', 'tourism']

    Foreign tourist arrivals may reach as high as 30 million this year, almost tripling from 11.2 million last year, according to some estimates

    Thailand has for long mooted an entry fee for foreign travelers but its implementation was delayed by the pandemic

    A part of the fee will help fund the development of local tourist attractions, Phiphat said

    The levy will be added to air ticket prices, while the method of collections from entry by land has yet to be determined, the government said last year

  • FATHER FINED RM10,000 FOR CAUSING THREE-MONTH-OLD BABY'S DEATH

    https://www.thesundaily.my/home/father-fined-rm10000-for-causing-three-month-old-baby-s-death-HE10636230

    02/14/2023, 19:08

    53.85% Shortened!

    Amirul Hakim pleaded guilty on Jan 31 to negligently causing the death of his son by inflicting head injuries at a house in Flat Sri Langkawi, Gombak, here, at 4.15 pm on Jan 3

    The doctor who treated the victim confirmed that the baby had broken his right thigh and was given fever medication

    After the incident, the accused took his son for a massage and the victim's legs were able to be straightened, but the victim suffered seizures twice, on Nov 30, 2022, and Jan 3, this year

    When the baby had a seizure on Jan 3, he was found limp and unresponsive

    While the accused was taking his son to the clinic, the accused's left hand hit an iron grate and his son's head hit the wooden frame of the front door

    Deputy Public Prosecutor Wan Ahmad Hakimi Wan Ahmad Jaafar prosecuted while Amirul Hakim was unrepresented

    ['year', 'jan', 'son', 'accuse', 'victim']

  • JOHOR CHIEF MINISTER PROPOSES TUAS-PUTERI HARBOUR FERRY SERVICES TO EASE SECOND LINK CONGESTION

    https://www.channelnewsasia.com/asia/johor-ferry-services-puteri-harbour-tuas-second-link-onn-hafiz-3277166

    02/14/2023, 19:08

    50.0% Shortened!

    Johor Chief Minister Onn Hafiz Ghazi and Singapore Transport Minister S Iswaran, who is also the country's Minister-in-charge of Trade Relations, meeting during Mr Onn Hafiz's three-day visit to Singapore on Feb 14, 2023

    He said at that time that the terminal is a key international entry point that increases access for tourists to come to Johor

    Mr Onn Hafiz said that last year, more than 141,000 tourists came from Batam and Tanjung Balai in Indonesia to Puteri terminal via ferry services owned and operated by Malaysia property developer UEM Sunrise.  Mr Onn Hafiz on Tuesday also shared other points of discussions between him and Mr Iswaran.  He said both of them agreed that the Johor Bahru-Singapore Rapid Transit System (RTS) Link was a priority for both countries.  “I agree with his suggestion to closely monitor the project's development, and to set short term and medium term goals so that the project continues to be on track,” said Mr Onn Hafiz.  The cross-border rail project aims to connect Bukit Chagar in Johor Bahru city to Woodlands in Singapore, serving about 10,000 passengers per hour each way to help ease traffic congestion on the Causeway

    It is scheduled to be operational by end-2026.  Mr Onn Hafiz also reiterated a commitment he said was made recently by Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim to increase motorcycle lanes at the immigration complex in Bangunan Sultan Iskandar, which is linked to the Woodlands Causeway.  “It is generally known that the Johor-Singapore Causeway is one of the busiest land crossings in the world, with more than 300,000 Malaysians commuting daily from Johor Bahru to work in Singapore,” said Mr Onn Hafiz.  The Machap state assemblyman added that he shared Mr Anwar’s willingness to see through a proposal to widen the lanes of the Johor portion of the North-South Highway.  “If this proposal is implemented, for sure it will benefit the business community in Singapore who wish to invest in Malaysia,” said Mr Onn Hafiz.  “I once again express the willingness of the Johor State Government to foster future collaborations between Johor-Singapore

    This close ties is significant for both parties,” he added.  Tuesday was the last day of Mr Onn Hafiz’s three-day working visit to Singapore

    Besides Mr Iswaran, he also met with other Singapore leaders like Minister for Sustainability and the Environment Grace Fu, Minister for Foreign Affairs Vivian Balakrishnan as well as Second Minister for Education and Foreign Affairs Maliki Osman.  The chief minister also held meetings with business leaders as well as foreign corporations based in Singapore.  He said in a statement on Sunday that these companies were potential investors that could rake in between RM10 to RM15 billion (US$2.3 to US$3.45 billion) for the southern state and bring high paying jobs for Johoreans.  “The state government, with the help of the federal government, is committed to be facilitators and prepare utilities and infrastructure, to ensure a friendly business environment for investors across the world,” he added.

    ['johor', 'minister', 'onn', 'hafiz', 'singapore']

    Johor Chief Minister Onn Hafiz Ghazi and Singapore Transport Minister S Iswaran, who is also the country's Minister-in-charge of Trade Relations, meeting during Mr Onn Hafiz's three-day visit to Singapore on Feb 14, 2023

    He said at that time that the terminal is a key international entry point that increases access for tourists to come to Johor

    Mr Onn Hafiz said that last year, more than 141,000 tourists came from Batam and Tanjung Balai in Indonesia to Puteri terminal via ferry services owned and operated by Malaysia property developer UEM Sunrise.  Mr Onn Hafiz on Tuesday also shared other points of discussions between him and Mr Iswaran.  He said both of them agreed that the Johor Bahru-Singapore Rapid Transit System (RTS) Link was a priority for both countries.  “I agree with his suggestion to closely monitor the project's development, and to set short term and medium term goals so that the project continues to be on track,” said Mr Onn Hafiz.  The cross-border rail project aims to connect Bukit Chagar in Johor Bahru city to Woodlands in Singapore, serving about 10,000 passengers per hour each way to help ease traffic congestion on the Causeway

    It is scheduled to be operational by end-2026.  Mr Onn Hafiz also reiterated a commitment he said was made recently by Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim to increase motorcycle lanes at the immigration complex in Bangunan Sultan Iskandar, which is linked to the Woodlands Causeway.  “It is generally known that the Johor-Singapore Causeway is one of the busiest land crossings in the world, with more than 300,000 Malaysians commuting daily from Johor Bahru to work in Singapore,” said Mr Onn Hafiz.  The Machap state assemblyman added that he shared Mr Anwar’s willingness to see through a proposal to widen the lanes of the Johor portion of the North-South Highway.  “If this proposal is implemented, for sure it will benefit the business community in Singapore who wish to invest in Malaysia,” said Mr Onn Hafiz.  “I once again express the willingness of the Johor State Government to foster future collaborations between Johor-Singapore

    This close ties is significant for both parties,” he added.  Tuesday was the last day of Mr Onn Hafiz’s three-day working visit to Singapore

    Besides Mr Iswaran, he also met with other Singapore leaders like Minister for Sustainability and the Environment Grace Fu, Minister for Foreign Affairs Vivian Balakrishnan as well as Second Minister for Education and Foreign Affairs Maliki Osman.  The chief minister also held meetings with business leaders as well as foreign corporations based in Singapore.  He said in a statement on Sunday that these companies were potential investors that could rake in between RM10 to RM15 billion (US$2.3 to US$3.45 billion) for the southern state and bring high paying jobs for Johoreans.  “The state government, with the help of the federal government, is committed to be facilitators and prepare utilities and infrastructure, to ensure a friendly business environment for investors across the world,” he added.

  • TITIWANGSA MP JOHARI GHANI WARNS SLOW ECONOMIC GROWTH PUTS MALAYSIA BEHIND ASEAN COUNTRIES

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2023/02/14/titiwangsa-mp-johari-ghani-warns-slow-economic-growth-puts-malaysia-behind-asean-countries/54919

    02/14/2023, 19:08

    62.5% Shortened!

    The former second finance minister said that the recent World Bank’s forecast showed that Malaysia will only score four per cent growth this year and 3.9 per cent next year, while neighbouring countries such as Indonesia, Philippines and Vietnam are expected to score 4.8 per cent up to 6.5 per cent “If the trend continues and the World Bank’s projections come true, it will lead to increased unemployment, and household incomes will not be able to cover the rising cost of living

    “In the first quarter of 2022, our economy grew 3.8 per cent, the second quarter dropped to little 3.5 per cent and the third quarter fell to 1.9 per cent, but what worried me was that when it came to the fourth quarter, the Malaysian economy contracted to -2.6 per cent

    “The World Bank predicts that in 2023 and 2024, Malaysia is only projected to grow by four per cent and fall by 3.9 per cent in 2024, meaning that the economy will decline lower than the average economic development before Covid-19 between 2017 and 2019 at an average of five per cent

    “When compared to other Asean economies, the World Bank predicts Indonesia will grow 4.8 per cent in 2023 and 4.9 per cent in 2024

    The Philippines will grow 5.4 per cent (2023) and 5.9 per cent (2024), while Vietnam is projected to grow 6.3 per cent (2023) and 6.5 per cent (2024)

    “On average between 2018 and 2022, the government took an average of almost RM60 billion from Petronas

    ['malaysia', 'country', 'per', 'cent', 'say']

    “In the first quarter of 2022, our economy grew 3.8 per cent, the second quarter dropped to little 3.5 per cent and the third quarter fell to 1.9 per cent, but what worried me was that when it came to the fourth quarter, the Malaysian economy contracted to -2.6 per cent

    “The World Bank predicts that in 2023 and 2024, Malaysia is only projected to grow by four per cent and fall by 3.9 per cent in 2024, meaning that the economy will decline lower than the average economic development before Covid-19 between 2017 and 2019 at an average of five per cent

    “When compared to other Asean economies, the World Bank predicts Indonesia will grow 4.8 per cent in 2023 and 4.9 per cent in 2024

    The Philippines will grow 5.4 per cent (2023) and 5.9 per cent (2024), while Vietnam is projected to grow 6.3 per cent (2023) and 6.5 per cent (2024)

  • CPI WILL SHOW WHETHER STOCKS OR BONDS GOT IT RIGHT

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/cpi-show-whether-stocks-bonds-210816814.html

    80.65% Shortened!

    Meanwhile, the stock market appears to be priced for an economy that largely withstands the Fed’s bid to cool inflation economy, a setup that will face a key test in Tuesday morning’s data

    The month-over-month reading is expected to rise 0.5% after falling by 0.1% at the last reading

    “The CPI is going to be a test of who’s got it right — the bond market or the stock market,” Art Hogan, chief market strategist at B

    “Right now, the anticipatory move in bond yields likely is right because the consensus is higher month over month on the CPI

    That means “we’re still far from more normal levels of both CPI reports and the market’s reaction to them,” he wrote

    In that case, “you’ll see the bond market reflect the fact that rates are going to continue to go up for the rest of the year,” she said in an interview

    ['stock', 'bond', 'market', 'inflation', 'say']

    “Right now, the anticipatory move in bond yields likely is right because the consensus is higher month over month on the CPI

    That means “we’re still far from more normal levels of both CPI reports and the market’s reaction to them,” he wrote

    In that case, “you’ll see the bond market reflect the fact that rates are going to continue to go up for the rest of the year,” she said in an interview

  • MR D.I.Y 4Q NET PROFIT RISES TO RM136MIL, DECLARES 0.6 SEN DIVIDEND

    https://www.thestar.com.my/business/business-news/2023/02/14/mr-diy-4q-net-profit-rises-to-rm136mil-declares-06-sen-dividend

    02/14/2023, 18:08

    62.5% Shortened!

    Group (M) Bhd optimistic about its prospects going forward, given the positive post-pandemic sentiment, according to chief executive officer Adrian Ong

    He said the group targets to open 180 new stores across all brands in 2023, which will bring the total nationwide store network to over 1,200 and further cement the group’s position as the largest home improvement retailer in the country

    The group’s store network expanded from 900 stores in the financial year ended Dec 31 (FY21) to 1,080 stores as of Dec 31, 2022, across its three brands - MR D.I.Y., MR TOY and MR DOLLAR

    In the fourth quarter ended Dec 31, Mr D.I.Y’s net profit rose 1.13% to RM136.1mil against RM134.5mil achieved in the same quarter last year

    The home improvement retailer’s earnings per share for the quarter rose to 1.44 sen from 1.43 sen a year prior

    Thank you for your report! Copyright © 1995-

    ['adrian', 'ong', 'group', 'post', 'rise']

    Group (M) Bhd optimistic about its prospects going forward, given the positive post-pandemic sentiment, according to chief executive officer Adrian Ong

    He said the group targets to open 180 new stores across all brands in 2023, which will bring the total nationwide store network to over 1,200 and further cement the group’s position as the largest home improvement retailer in the country

    The group’s store network expanded from 900 stores in the financial year ended Dec 31 (FY21) to 1,080 stores as of Dec 31, 2022, across its three brands - MR D.I.Y., MR TOY and MR DOLLAR

    In the fourth quarter ended Dec 31, Mr D.I.Y’s net profit rose 1.13% to RM136.1mil against RM134.5mil achieved in the same quarter last year

    The home improvement retailer’s earnings per share for the quarter rose to 1.44 sen from 1.43 sen a year prior

    "The panel has concluded that UEFA, as event owner, bears primary responsibility for failures which almost led to disaster," the report said

    Liverpool responded with a statement released on Tuesday which agreed with the report's findings, condemning UEFA for their handling of the Paris final and calling for the governing body to "fully and transparently" implement the recommendations made in the independent report

    UEFA's Head of Safety & Security Operations, Zeljko Pavlica, who was at the game, is not identified by name in the 220 pages

    "On the evidence, the panel has concluded that the senior management of UEFA Events marginalized the UEFA S&S Unit,'' the report said

    The report team was chaired by a former sports minister of Portugal, Tiago Brandao Rodrigues, and included match security experts who formerly worked for UEFA and fan groups

    The Champions League final was moved to Paris at three months' notice after UEFA stripped Russia of hosting the game in St

    The Larut MP said the government's intention to create unity among the people must be based on sincerity and wisdom

    "Unfortunately, the witch-hunting under the current government against their political opponents has not ended

    "(The King’s) decree that a stable nation can only be achieved through cooperation between the government and opposition is something that all MPs can agree on

    "That is why the government must do something to build the people's confidence

    Hamzah, who was also a Cabinet minister under the previous government, claimed credit for the successes and the improvements achieved by the country

    ['opposition', 'hamzah', 'government', 'say', 'people']

    Both dogs had passed training certified by the International Rescue Dog Organisation and have been tasked to search for earthquake victims in the rubble

    Mexico on Monday paid tribute to its military rescue dog that died while searching for survivors buried under the rubble of the earthquake in Turkey

    An archive of the post can be found here

    Several social media users have shared the clip

    A search on Yandex led us to the name of the film, "Восьмое чудо света 1981." Taking this as a hint, we performed a keyword search on YouTube and found the full length of the film uploaded on a channel called 'Alice May' on 3 June 2017

    The film's plot revolved around Soviet basketball players who participated in international competitions for the Hera Cup

    The film was directed by Samson Samsonov and was written by Vladimir Kapitanovsky

  • SYSTEM UPDATE SOON FOR JPJ APP, WEBSITE TO ENHANCE SECURITY, SAYS TRANSPORT MINISTER

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/02/14/system-update-soon-for-jpj-app-website-to-enhance-security-says-transport-minister

    02/14/2023, 17:08

    45.45% Shortened!

    Tuesday, 14 Feb 2023

    Anthony Loke said that road users looking to register for a digital road tax would soon have to input the unique code located behind their driving licence in addition to their IC number during registration

    He said that he has discussed this thoroughly with JPJ and the system update will likely roll out soon

    Loke said the new registration requirement would only apply to those that have yet to register through the JPJ app or website and that existing users would not be required to comply with the new requirements

    He added that the digitalisation of road tax would remain voluntary and there would be no mandate yet on forcing all road users to register into the system

    We would love to keep you posted on the latest promotion

  • DISABLED RIGHTS ACTIVIST ANTHONY THANASAYAN DIES

    https://www.malaysiakini.com/news/655070

    02/14/2023, 17:08

    50.0% Shortened!

    Former Petaling Jaya City Council (MBPJ) member and wheelchair-user activist Anthony Thanasayan passed away due to a lung infection

    He was the first disabled local government councillor in Selangor

    In a statement this afternoon, MBPJ councillor Derek Fernandez described Thanasayan (above), whom he had known since 2008, as a fighter

    He made me realise that every one of us will be disabled one day, some more than others but all of us will be disabled one day

    "Ageing is a disability and disabled people should not be hidden away but deserve their days in the sun, just like everyone else," Derek said

    He was also a frequent contributor to various news organisations documenting the challenges faced by disabled people in living a life with dignity.

    ['mbpj', 'due', 'people', 'disabled', 'one']

    Former Petaling Jaya City Council (MBPJ) member and wheelchair-user activist Anthony Thanasayan passed away due to a lung infection

    He was the first disabled local government councillor in Selangor

    In a statement this afternoon, MBPJ councillor Derek Fernandez described Thanasayan (above), whom he had known since 2008, as a fighter

    He made me realise that every one of us will be disabled one day, some more than others but all of us will be disabled one day

    "Ageing is a disability and disabled people should not be hidden away but deserve their days in the sun, just like everyone else," Derek said

  • PALANTIR JUMPS AFTER PROJECTING FIRST ANNUAL PROFIT IN 2023

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/palantir-jumps-projecting-first-annual-232543374.html

    73.91% Shortened!

    (Bloomberg) -- Palantir Technologies Inc., the data analysis company co-founded by Peter Thiel, said it was profitable for the first time in the fourth quarter, and expects 2023 to be its first-ever profitable year

    Palantir reported $508.6 million in sales in the fourth quarter

    Palantir’s revenue from its commercial clients, a closely watched metric, increased 11% to $215 million, in line with analyst estimates

    “In the military context, it has already arrived.” On the call, Palantir Chief Technology Officer Shyam Sankar said that the company had an eventful 2022

    The company’s sales to governments increased 23% to $293 million during the fourth quarter, with $225 million of that coming from deals with the US

    The company’s adjusted operating margin was 22% in the fourth quarter, higher than analyst estimates of 15.75%

    ['palantir', 'company', 'say', 'fourth', 'year']

    (Bloomberg) -- Palantir Technologies Inc., the data analysis company co-founded by Peter Thiel, said it was profitable for the first time in the fourth quarter, and expects 2023 to be its first-ever profitable year

    Palantir reported $508.6 million in sales in the fourth quarter

    Palantir’s revenue from its commercial clients, a closely watched metric, increased 11% to $215 million, in line with analyst estimates

    “In the military context, it has already arrived.” On the call, Palantir Chief Technology Officer Shyam Sankar said that the company had an eventful 2022

    The company’s sales to governments increased 23% to $293 million during the fourth quarter, with $225 million of that coming from deals with the US

    The company’s adjusted operating margin was 22% in the fourth quarter, higher than analyst estimates of 15.75%

    ['palantir', 'company', 'say', 'fourth', 'year']



  • SABAH SEEKS TO PUT MALAYSIA ON WORLD MAP AS NEW SPACE LAUNCH SITE

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2023/02/14/sabah-seeks-to-put-malaysia-on-world-map-as-new-space-launch-site/54892

    02/14/2023, 16:08

    53.85% Shortened!

    State Science, Technology and Innovation minister Datuk Arifin Arif announced that the state Cabinet has greenlit a feasibility study towards this goal, adding that a letter of intent will be awarded to Sovereign Sengalang Sdn Bhd

    The initiative will be under the state agency known as Sabah Space Industrial Corporation that will work with the Malaysian Space Agency

    “The first step is the feasibility study which will determine if an international Space Launch Industrial Centre can be built in the identified location,” Arifin said

    He added that the state hopes to create between 300 and 500 aeronautical space companies that can provide up to 5,000 jobs, including 90 highly paid positions

    A series of discussions have already been conducted between the state and Sovereign Sengalang, the company undertaking the feasibility study

    Arifin, who took over the state ministry from Datuk Yakub Khan earlier this year, also spoke its plans for the state which include upgrading the state’s internet coverage and building more science centres to increase knowledge and awareness for the science and technology sector.

    ['sabah', 'location', 'space', 'launch', 'state']

    State Science, Technology and Innovation minister Datuk Arifin Arif announced that the state Cabinet has greenlit a feasibility study towards this goal, adding that a letter of intent will be awarded to Sovereign Sengalang Sdn Bhd

    The initiative will be under the state agency known as Sabah Space Industrial Corporation that will work with the Malaysian Space Agency

    “The first step is the feasibility study which will determine if an international Space Launch Industrial Centre can be built in the identified location,” Arifin said

    He added that the state hopes to create between 300 and 500 aeronautical space companies that can provide up to 5,000 jobs, including 90 highly paid positions

    A series of discussions have already been conducted between the state and Sovereign Sengalang, the company undertaking the feasibility study

    Arifin, who took over the state ministry from Datuk Yakub Khan earlier this year, also spoke its plans for the state which include upgrading the state’s internet coverage and building more science centres to increase knowledge and awareness for the science and technology sector.

    ['sabah', 'location', 'space', 'launch', 'state']



  • MACC OBTAINS COURT ORDER TO DETAIN THREE FOR FALSIFYING DOCUMENTS

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/02/14/macc-obtains-court-order-to-detain-three-for-falsifying-documents

    02/14/2023, 16:08

    45.45% Shortened!

    Tuesday, 14 Feb 2023

    Magistrate Noorhafizah Ishak issued a seven-day order to remand the trio, including two others who were self-employed, till Feb 20 to allow the MACC to carry out its probe

    The self-employed suspects, aged 63 and 40 years old, respectively, were detained in Muar, Johor, while the 44-year-old contractor was detained at the MACC office here on Monday (Feb 13)

    They are being probed for conspiring to use a company to submit false documents which include a Construction Industry Development Board (CIDB) registration certificate, CIDB documents on government projects obtained and a Bumiputra contractor Certificate to a government department in Muar to secure a RM130,000 project

    When contacted, state MACC director Awgkok Ahmad Taufik Putra Awg Ismail said the case was being investigated under Section 18 of the MACC Act.

    Thank you for your report! Copyright © 1995-

    ['feb', 'obtain', 'include', 'contractor', 'document']

    Tuesday, 14 Feb 2023

    Magistrate Noorhafizah Ishak issued a seven-day order to remand the trio, including two others who were self-employed, till Feb 20 to allow the MACC to carry out its probe

    The self-employed suspects, aged 63 and 40 years old, respectively, were detained in Muar, Johor, while the 44-year-old contractor was detained at the MACC office here on Monday (Feb 13)

    They are being probed for conspiring to use a company to submit false documents which include a Construction Industry Development Board (CIDB) registration certificate, CIDB documents on government projects obtained and a Bumiputra contractor Certificate to a government department in Muar to secure a RM130,000 project

    When contacted, state MACC director Awgkok Ahmad Taufik Putra Awg Ismail said the case was being investigated under Section 18 of the MACC Act.

  • PUTERI SARAH GETS LEAVE TO BEGIN CONTEMPT ACTION AGAINST IRA KAZAR AND FAMILY

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/02/14/puteri-sarah-gets-leave-to-begin-contempt-action-against-ira-kazar-and-family

    02/14/2023, 16:08

    64.71% Shortened!

    Puteri Sarah filed for leave to initiate committal proceedings against Ira, whose full name is Faghira Fatini, her sister Yasmin, and Kazaruddin over an alleged breach of a court injunction following the revelation of Ira's marriage to Puteri Sarah's husband, actor and director Syamsul Yusof, last month

    In the leave application filed on Jan 31, Puteri Sarah, whose full name is Puteri Sarah Liyana Megat Kamaruddin, claimed that the three defendants had committed contempt of court when they voluntarily violated an inter-parte injunction order dated July 4 last year

    The injunction order was part of a lawsuit filed by Puteri Sarah in June, after she claimed she was on the receiving end of a barrage of harassment and threats from Ira, 27, via social media

    On Jan 6, Syamsul admitted in an Instagram video that he had married Ira in Thailand

    On Jan 16, Puteri Sarah filed for divorce from Syamsul after almost nine years of marriage

    Puteri Sarah also stated that she and her children no longer lived with Syamsul, either at her in-laws’ house or at their matrimonial home in Taman Melawati

    ['puteri', 'sarah', 'ira', 'file', 'syamsul']

  • RHB LISTS FOUR MALAYSIAN STOCKS IN ITS 2023 REGIONAL ESG TOP PICKS

    https://www.theedgemarkets.com/node/655153

    02/14/2023, 15:08

    75.0% Shortened!

    “Press Metal’s PT Bintan Phase 2 is currently 84% completed

    At the noon break on Tuesday, shares in Press Metal were up 12 sen or 2.33% at RM5.27, giving the company a market capitalisation of RM43.42 billion

    RHB analyst Jeffrey Tan projects TIME dotCom to post an ROE of 13.5% for FY2022, and 16% for FY2023, from 12% in FY2021, supported by stronger earnings growth from continued expansion of its fibre footprint, higher utilisation of data centres, and increased cloud offerings demand

    TIME dotCom shares were up one sen or 0.19% at the noon break, valuing the company at RM9.76 billion

    RHB analyst Lee Meng Horng forecast Samaiden to achieve an ROE of 19.9% for FY2023, and 20.7% for FY2024, versus 17.7% in FY2022, driven by higher net margins stemming from a decline in photovoltaic module cost, as well as the group’s earnings growth

    “[Samaiden] is trading at a discount to its Malaysian utility peers at 13 times FY2024 PER versus 14 times,” Lee continued, adding that RHB believes the stock is trading at an undemanding valuation, given the group’s three-year 33.8% earnings CAGR driven by its sturdy order book growth

    ['rhb', 'press', 'metal', 'group', 'time']

    “Press Metal’s PT Bintan Phase 2 is currently 84% completed

    At the noon break on Tuesday, shares in Press Metal were up 12 sen or 2.33% at RM5.27, giving the company a market capitalisation of RM43.42 billion

    RHB analyst Jeffrey Tan projects TIME dotCom to post an ROE of 13.5% for FY2022, and 16% for FY2023, from 12% in FY2021, supported by stronger earnings growth from continued expansion of its fibre footprint, higher utilisation of data centres, and increased cloud offerings demand

    TIME dotCom shares were up one sen or 0.19% at the noon break, valuing the company at RM9.76 billion

    RHB analyst Lee Meng Horng forecast Samaiden to achieve an ROE of 19.9% for FY2023, and 20.7% for FY2024, versus 17.7% in FY2022, driven by higher net margins stemming from a decline in photovoltaic module cost, as well as the group’s earnings growth

    “[Samaiden] is trading at a discount to its Malaysian utility peers at 13 times FY2024 PER versus 14 times,” Lee continued, adding that RHB believes the stock is trading at an undemanding valuation, given the group’s three-year 33.8% earnings CAGR driven by its sturdy order book growth

    62.5% Shortened!

    Tuesday, 14 Feb 2023

    Wan Ahmad Fayhsal had asked when the government will introduce targeted PTPTN loan abolition for B40 households and the number of borrowers who will benefit from it

    He also noted that the government has allowed loan repayments to be restructured based on the borrowers’ financial capabilities

    Loan repayments also only begin 12 months after the borrowers have completed their higher studies to give them time to earn a stable income,” said Khaled To an additional question whether the government has promised to introduce the targeted abolition since it was previously listed as part of the election manifesto, Khaled said one of the parties under the Unity Government had decided to totally abolish PTPTN loan repayments

    Economy Minister Rafizi Ramli then stood up and wanted to refer Wan Ahmad Fayhsal to the Parliament's Rights and Privileges Committee for trying to mislead the Dewan Rakyat on the issue

    "In this matter, I want to refer Machang to the committee for saying that there was a promise to abolish PTPTN and it was listed part of our election manifesto, that is a lie

  • RAFIZI 'SCHOOLS' HAMZAH IN DEWAN RAKYAT ON CONCEPT OF ECONOMIC GROWTH

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/02/14/rafizi-039schools039-hamzah-in-dewan-rakyat-on-concept-of-economic-growth

    02/14/2023, 15:08

    72.0% Shortened!

    Rafizi had said that although Malaysia registered gross domestic product (GDP) growth of 8.7% last year, the quarter-by-quarter growth recorded a steady decline

    He explained that the 8.7% referred to annual growth of the size of the economy from 2021 to 2022

    “It is not me who needs to correct the data, but the Opposition leader must correct his understanding regarding economic growth,” said Rafizi

    “We should not deny the fact that the growth was planned by the previous government

    “Rafizi wants to state that as if there is no growth, let’s not show there was economic decline

    “We should not be content with 8.7% growth

    The past four quarters (last year) have declined and in 2023, we will face slower economic growth,” said Rafizi

    ['economic', 'growth', 'say', 'economy', 'rafizi']

    Rafizi had said that although Malaysia registered gross domestic product (GDP) growth of 8.7% last year, the quarter-by-quarter growth recorded a steady decline

    He explained that the 8.7% referred to annual growth of the size of the economy from 2021 to 2022

    “It is not me who needs to correct the data, but the Opposition leader must correct his understanding regarding economic growth,” said Rafizi

    “We should not deny the fact that the growth was planned by the previous government

    “Rafizi wants to state that as if there is no growth, let’s not show there was economic decline

    “We should not be content with 8.7% growth

    The past four quarters (last year) have declined and in 2023, we will face slower economic growth,” said Rafizi

    ['economic', 'growth', 'say', 'economy', 'rafizi']



  • PERODUA LAUNCHES ALL-NEW AXIA, PRICED FROM RM38,600

    https://www.thestar.com.my/business/business-news/2023/02/14/perodua-launches-all-new-axia-priced-from-rm38600

    02/14/2023, 15:07

    57.14% Shortened!

    The 1.0 litre D-CVT (Dual-Mode CVT) all-new Perodua Axia comes in four variants G, X, SE, and AV

    The all-new Axia offers a variety of choices for Malaysians to choose from

    “With the all-new Perodua Axia launched, our focus (for this new model) are twofold, the first is maximising deliveries to our customers and to convert previous generation Axia bookings to the All-New Axia,” president and chief executive officer Datuk Zainal Abidin Ahmad said in a statement

    He said that of the 44,000 existing orders, Perodua was able to convince 13,600 of its customers to convert to the latest model and coupled with over new 6,500 bookings (since Jan 31) – the compact car company has a combined orders of 20,100 units

    Zainal said that the all-new Perodua Axia a sales target of 5,700 units a month, and to meet this sales target, the compact car company has set the model’s annual production target to over 82,000 units.

    Thank you for your report! Copyright © 1995-

    ['perodua', 'late', 'model', 'new', 'axia']

    The 1.0 litre D-CVT (Dual-Mode CVT) all-new Perodua Axia comes in four variants G, X, SE, and AV

    The all-new Axia offers a variety of choices for Malaysians to choose from

    “With the all-new Perodua Axia launched, our focus (for this new model) are twofold, the first is maximising deliveries to our customers and to convert previous generation Axia bookings to the All-New Axia,” president and chief executive officer Datuk Zainal Abidin Ahmad said in a statement

    He said that of the 44,000 existing orders, Perodua was able to convince 13,600 of its customers to convert to the latest model and coupled with over new 6,500 bookings (since Jan 31) – the compact car company has a combined orders of 20,100 units

    Zainal said that the all-new Perodua Axia a sales target of 5,700 units a month, and to meet this sales target, the compact car company has set the model’s annual production target to over 82,000 units.

  • ANDREW TATE ARREST CASTS LIGHT ON ROMANIA'S SEXCAM BOOM

    https://www.thestar.com.my/tech/tech-news/2023/02/14/andrew-tate-arrest-casts-light-on-romanias-sexcam-boom

    02/14/2023, 14:08

    81.82% Shortened!

    Alexandra, head of marketing for a videochat studio, poses for photos in one of the studio rooms in Bucharest, Romania on Jan 26, 2023

    The arrest of controversial online influencer Andrew Tate's for alleged rape and human trafficking in Romania has shone a spotlight on the country's burgeoning sexcam industry

    “The Tate brothers are not known in the industry and have never participated in industry events,” said Maria Boroghina, a manager at Best Studios, one of Romania’s biggest sexcam operators

    ‘This is not fair’ But defenders of the industry like Boroghina and Ruxandra Tataru, an organiser of a sexcam industry event called the Bucharest Summit, said they would welcome regulation

    “Romanian women represent 40% of the videochat industry worldwide,” said Anastasia, a 33-year-old former camgirl, who is the “models’ representative” at another Bucharest studio, Models4Models

    The studio’s head of marketing, Alexandra, who declined to give her full name, said it was “unjust that from a scandal like this people think that Andrew Tate represents the videochat industry

    ['studio', 'tate', 'industry', 'woman', 'romanian']

  • SEREMBAN WOMAN FINED RM3,000 FOR INJURING EX-COLLEAGUE WITH DRINKING GLASS

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/02/14/seremban-woman-fined-rm3000-for-injuring-ex-colleague-with-drinking-glass

    02/14/2023, 14:08

    58.82% Shortened!

    Tuesday, 14 Feb 2023

    Nur Shahirah Choo Fui Tze Chen, 40 who is now heavily pregnant, pleaded guilty to the charge after it was read to her before magistrate Mohamad Ibrahim Mohammad Ghulam

    According to the facts of the case, both the accused and the victim were colleagues at a reflexology centre but Nur Shahirah was fired a few weeks before the incident at the restaurant

    She then realised that her attacker was her former colleague

    The accused, who also had a 13-year-old child, said she was also due to give birth at any time

    Deputy public prosecutor Nurul Muhaimin Mohd Azman asked the court to impose a sentence that would deter would-be offenders.

    Thank you for your report! Copyright © 1995-

  • TECH LAYOFFS: COMPANIES THAT ANNOUNCED JOB-CUTS SO FAR IN 2023

    https://www.peoplematters.in/news/employee-relations/tech-layoffs-2023-companies-that-have-made-cuts-36867

    02/14/2023, 14:08

    92.68% Shortened!

    That's around 3.6% of their global workforce

    eBay goes ahead with plan to slash 4% of its workforce The online marketplace said in February it would cut 500 jobs, or about 4% of its global workforce, according to an internal email included with a securities filing

    The cuts will include five per cent of the company's global workforce, reports Bloomberg, citing sources

    IBM annunces plan to slash 3,900 jobs - 1.5% of its workforce The company plans to cut about 3,900 workers, its chief financial officer declared in January

    Ford to cut 3,200 jobs across Europe to cut costs In the last week of January, Ford Motor Co

    The planned workforce reduction is part of the company's efforts to cut costs to face ongoing macroeconomic conditions amid recession fears

    ['job', 'layoff', 'company', 'cut', 'workforce']

  • ZAFRUL: STRONG POLICIES, EV ECOSYSTEM TO RAMP UP MALAYSIA'S EV SECTOR

    https://www.thesundaily.my/business/zafrul-strong-policies-ev-ecosystem-to-ramp-up-malaysia-s-ev-sector-AE10634062

    02/14/2023, 14:08

    57.14% Shortened!

    Minister Tengku Datuk Seri Zafrul Tengku Abdul Aziz said Malaysia is seriously looking into policies that will support energy sectors to ensure that the EV ecosystem is complete and fully supported, including standards, certification and verification related to charging systems and battery disposal activities

    “Opportunities abound in the areas of renewable energy (RE), energy efficiency, energy storage systems, and support services for EVs, such as EV charging stations, operation and maintenance,” he said in his keynote address at Malaysia’s EV Conference 2023

    To capitalise on the EV market, Tengku Zafrul said the government will also strengthen Malaysia’s Technical and Vocational Education and Training (TVET)

    He added that the government has made a firm commitment to strategically develop the automotive industry, particularly the EV industry, as part of the zero greenhouse gas (GHG) target by 2050

    He said the shift to RE sources and electric transportation is a significant step towards Malaysia’s commitment to net-zero GHG by 2050, as outlined in the Twelfth Malaysia Plan (12MP)

    Tengku Zafrul added that under the Low Carbon Mobility Blueprint 2021-2030, Malaysia aims to have EVs and hybrid to account for at least 15 per cent of the total industry volume (TIV) by 2030

    ['malaysia', 'industry', 'say', 'tengku', 'charge']

    Minister Tengku Datuk Seri Zafrul Tengku Abdul Aziz said Malaysia is seriously looking into policies that will support energy sectors to ensure that the EV ecosystem is complete and fully supported, including standards, certification and verification related to charging systems and battery disposal activities

    “Opportunities abound in the areas of renewable energy (RE), energy efficiency, energy storage systems, and support services for EVs, such as EV charging stations, operation and maintenance,” he said in his keynote address at Malaysia’s EV Conference 2023

    To capitalise on the EV market, Tengku Zafrul said the government will also strengthen Malaysia’s Technical and Vocational Education and Training (TVET)

    He added that the government has made a firm commitment to strategically develop the automotive industry, particularly the EV industry, as part of the zero greenhouse gas (GHG) target by 2050

    He said the shift to RE sources and electric transportation is a significant step towards Malaysia’s commitment to net-zero GHG by 2050, as outlined in the Twelfth Malaysia Plan (12MP)

    Tengku Zafrul added that under the Low Carbon Mobility Blueprint 2021-2030, Malaysia aims to have EVs and hybrid to account for at least 15 per cent of the total industry volume (TIV) by 2030

    ['malaysia', 'industry', 'say', 'tengku', 'charge']

  • TENGKU ZAFRUL: GOVT LOOKING INTO STRONG POLICIES TO RAMP UP MALAYSIA’S EV SECTOR

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2023/02/14/tengku-zafrul-govt-looking-into-strong-policies-to-ramp-up-malaysias-ev-sector/54867

    02/14/2023, 14:07

    60.0% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Feb 14 — Malaysia is taking steps to strengthen its position through various policy measures, leveraging the existing electric vehicles (EV) ecosystem and ensuring a solid talent pipeline to help the development of the EV industry in Malaysia, said the Ministry of International Trade and Industry (Miti)

    Minister Datuk Seri Tengku Zafrul Tengku Abdul Aziz said Malaysia is seriously looking into policies that will support energy sectors to ensure that the EV ecosystem is complete and fully supported, including standards, certification and verification related to charging systems and battery disposal activities

    To capitalise on the EV market, Tengku Zafrul said the government will also strengthen Malaysia’s Technical and Vocational Education and Training (TVET)

    He added that the government has made a firm commitment to strategically develop the automotive industry, particularly the EV industry, as part of the zero greenhouse gas (GHG) target by 2050

    He said the shift to RE sources and electric transportation is a significant step towards Malaysia’s commitment to net-zero GHG by 2050, as outlined in the Twelfth Malaysia Plan (12MP)

    Tengku Zafrul added that under the Low Carbon Mobility Blueprint 2021-2030, Malaysia aims to have EVs and hybrid to account for at least 15 per cent of the total industry volume (TIV) by 2030

    ['malaysia', 'industry', 'say', 'tengku', 'charge']

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Feb 14 — Malaysia is taking steps to strengthen its position through various policy measures, leveraging the existing electric vehicles (EV) ecosystem and ensuring a solid talent pipeline to help the development of the EV industry in Malaysia, said the Ministry of International Trade and Industry (Miti)

    Minister Datuk Seri Tengku Zafrul Tengku Abdul Aziz said Malaysia is seriously looking into policies that will support energy sectors to ensure that the EV ecosystem is complete and fully supported, including standards, certification and verification related to charging systems and battery disposal activities

    To capitalise on the EV market, Tengku Zafrul said the government will also strengthen Malaysia’s Technical and Vocational Education and Training (TVET)

    He added that the government has made a firm commitment to strategically develop the automotive industry, particularly the EV industry, as part of the zero greenhouse gas (GHG) target by 2050

    He said the shift to RE sources and electric transportation is a significant step towards Malaysia’s commitment to net-zero GHG by 2050, as outlined in the Twelfth Malaysia Plan (12MP)

    Tengku Zafrul added that under the Low Carbon Mobility Blueprint 2021-2030, Malaysia aims to have EVs and hybrid to account for at least 15 per cent of the total industry volume (TIV) by 2030

    ['malaysia', 'industry', 'say', 'tengku', 'charge']



  • PHILIPPINES' MARCOS SUMMONS CHINA ENVOY OVER LASER INCIDENT AT SEA

    https://www.channelnewsasia.com/asia/philippines-condemns-china-laser-use-against-ship-3276726

    02/14/2023

    78.57% Shortened!

    Marcos confronted Chinese ambassador Huang Xilian on Tuesday "over the increasing frequency and intensity of actions by China" against the Philippine Coast Guard and Filipino fishermen, spokeswoman Cheloy Velicaria-Garafil said

    Chinese foreign ministry spokesman Wang Wenbin insisted on Tuesday that the China Coast Guard had "operated with professionalism and restraint"

    US State Department spokesman Ned Price on Monday criticised the China Coast Guard's actions as "provocative and unsafe"

    "The United States stands with our Philippine allies in the face of the People's Republic of China coast guard's reported use of laser devices against the crew of a Philippine Coast Guard ship," Price said

    The Philippine patrol boat was supporting a "rotation and resupply mission" for the marines in Second Thomas Shoal when the Chinese vessel pointed the laser light at them twice, the Philippine Coast Guard said on Monday

    It was not the first time that a Chinese coast guard boat had pointed a laser light at a Philippine vessel, said Commodore Jay Tarriela, a maritime security adviser in the Philippine Coast Guard

    ['say', 'china', 'philippine', 'coast', 'guard']

    Marcos confronted Chinese ambassador Huang Xilian on Tuesday "over the increasing frequency and intensity of actions by China" against the Philippine Coast Guard and Filipino fishermen, spokeswoman Cheloy Velicaria-Garafil said

    Chinese foreign ministry spokesman Wang Wenbin insisted on Tuesday that the China Coast Guard had "operated with professionalism and restraint"

    US State Department spokesman Ned Price on Monday criticised the China Coast Guard's actions as "provocative and unsafe"

    "The United States stands with our Philippine allies in the face of the People's Republic of China coast guard's reported use of laser devices against the crew of a Philippine Coast Guard ship," Price said

    The Philippine patrol boat was supporting a "rotation and resupply mission" for the marines in Second Thomas Shoal when the Chinese vessel pointed the laser light at them twice, the Philippine Coast Guard said on Monday

    It was not the first time that a Chinese coast guard boat had pointed a laser light at a Philippine vessel, said Commodore Jay Tarriela, a maritime security adviser in the Philippine Coast Guard

    ['say', 'china', 'philippine', 'coast', 'guard']



  • RINGGIT OPENS HIGHER AGAINST US$ AHEAD OF US CPI PRINT

    https://www.thestar.com.my/business/business-news/2023/02/14/ringgit-opens-higher-against-us-ahead-of-us-cpi-print

    02/14/2023

    45.45% Shortened!

    Tuesday, 14 Feb 2023

    SPI Asset Management managing director Stephen Innes said the US dollar weakened amid better risk sentiment and as fast money traders performed the usual housekeeping duties by reducing risk ahead of Tuesday's US inflation print

    "If the US CPI print fails to print above grade, an improving macro backdrop could further cheapen the US dollar,” he told Bernama

    From a technical point of view, the ringgit-US dollar could move to the 4.4000 region where it might encounter resistance,” he said

    Back home, the ringgit, however, traded lower against a basket of major currencies

    Thank you for your report! Copyright © 1995-

    ['ringgit', 'dollar', 'cpi', 'say', 'asset']

    Tuesday, 14 Feb 2023

    SPI Asset Management managing director Stephen Innes said the US dollar weakened amid better risk sentiment and as fast money traders performed the usual housekeeping duties by reducing risk ahead of Tuesday's US inflation print

    "If the US CPI print fails to print above grade, an improving macro backdrop could further cheapen the US dollar,” he told Bernama

    From a technical point of view, the ringgit-US dollar could move to the 4.4000 region where it might encounter resistance,” he said

    Back home, the ringgit, however, traded lower against a basket of major currencies

    Thank you for your report! Copyright © 1995-
